Screaming "O" Roll - Not my favorite, but I had heard quite a bit about it and had to try it. There happened to be a minute amount of wasabi lurking somewhere within, so I wasn't too keen on the flavor. Other than that, great stuff. 
Cocktails - The Fresh Fruit Gin Fizz and Pocket Fours are both wonderful. Nothing fancy, just served in a pint glass with tons of freshness. Not too boozy either. I'd order both again in a heartbeat. 

The service was great as well. Our server was nice and to the point. Not too much nonsense or over-communication, which I appreciate. 

Pisces is a great choice for sushi and cocktails. Also, never had the chance to witness him in his element behind the bar, but I know Bob Peters slings a mighty fine beverage.

As I know,they have fresh fish order from Japan every week. I always like to order love boat,which is sushi combs for two people.The taste is amazing and fresh.Rainbow roll is my favorite too. I love this place!

Great place! This is the first time I've been here-and I'm happy I tried it. It happened to be restaurant week, which was great. Our server was fabulous and helpful, she had great suggestions and was genuinely happy to be there (which isn't often in restaurants)! She was wonderful. We had the garlic spicy edamame and chicken sesame appetizers; hibachi and screaming O for our entrées- so delicious.  The fresh fish was so fresh and high quality. We will come back again soon!

Went for the $10 all-you-can-eat lunch. The sushi was as expected, it's a very good deal. The reason this review gets five stars is due to the service, specifically, our server, Lena. She was so on top of it, knew exactly when we need more to drink, when we wanted to order more food, when to bring the check. It was incredibly seamless and it appeared the entire staff acted in the same manner to their respective tables.

Had a reservation, although we were seated a little over 45 minutes later, the booth was worth the wait. They are shaped liked coves. Interesting. The only thing I didn't like was the cocktails. I had a Bittersweet Symphony-- it just tasted like puree and ice. I was surprised there were no special martini's, like Lychee. 
The food though-- soooo good. The bacon wrapped scallops. amazing!! we got 2 rolls and 4 sushi pieces. you can taste the fresh fish. We chose the Karyu and the Aries Rolls and 4 salmon nigiri pieces. 
The place is not THAT big. My second drink was my standard Dirty Martini Straight up.
 But Definitely going back to try more items. 
It was very busy, so they are doing something right!
I was surprised they had nothing with Smoked Salmon though. Oh well.

Went here for a lunch date with a friend. Atmosphere is cool, and we got to sit in one of the private booths. We both did the all you can eat option for lunch. We wished we had known the rolls were simply going to be fish seaweed and rice. The quality of the fish was not bad, but I'm not sure I would dine here again.

Highly recommend the tempura fried oreo's...delicious.

Love the atmosphere and sushi!  

My friends and I prefer Pisces over their loud competitor (Nikko)...who wants to feel like they are eating in a club with a woman dancing around with a tamborine? Ridiculous.

Service is good, area is great and sushi is good as well. They have an all you can eat special just make sure you know the rules. Eat all the sushi or they charge you extra. Hence the charging of the take out boxes as well. Make sure you get one of the non sushi things as well if you are getting the special like the garlic noodles! My fav.
Food was good... waitress was good,  all you can eat Sushi for $10 for like 3 hrs I was all in.... only two things Id say needed to be corrected was they needed Tamari and I felt rushed....

Bad sushi, cheap manager. All you can eat sushi is a joke.  Tuna looked black, eal looked ill, rice 80%, fish 20%. Menu for all you can eat is poor. Only few selections for nigiri. It does say on the menu that you will be charged for wasted food, so i decided not to waste any and only left 50% of rice from 8 pieces of nigiri that i ordered, because rice tasted old and chewy.  I went to the chef and asked to put less rise in my next order. To my surprise sushi came with visibly more rise. In my bill i found a charge of 8 dollars for wasted rice. Rude manager said it was her who advised the waiter to add the charge and that we were warned and if  i wanted to eat less rice i needed to order from a regular menu and refused to wave the extra fee, saying that she is sorry  , but has to protect the restaurant. I have had sushi a la card and all you can eat  in many different cities, i know what i m talking about. Take your business somewhere else.

I have now been to Pisces, located in the heart of the Met twice, and I have thoroughly enjoyed my experience there each time.  

The ambiance of Pisces is noticeable the second you walk in the door.  Despite the fact that its sandwiched in a busy plaza in the heart of Charlotte, the interior feels, calm, clean and quiet.  

The service has been top notch the two times I've been there.  I've sat at the bar and ordered drinks.  I've also sat at a table for their lunch.  Each time, my server was the same chill dude, he knew what he was doing, and was very knowledgeable about the sushi and the variety of rolls they offer.  In addition, my order was correct and served in a timely fashion.  

The food, in this case, sushi, was excellent.  I've had a few different rolls and they tasted fresh, were full of flavor, and stayed intact.

What else is there to say?  The ONE AND ONLY REASON, I am not giving Pisces 5-STARS is because of its location in the MET and the cluster-fu*k of a parking garage they have over there!  Its sad to say, but I don't go here more often because I'd rather peel off my fingernails than park at the "trendy" Met.   

Finally, I wouldn't be doing my job as a Yelper, if I didn't mention that Pisces has the BEST ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI DEAL in CHARLOTTE!  You really have to go here to believe the quality and variety of fresh, made to order sushi you can get for one low price (around $12).

Otherwise, I love Pisces, and I will be there sometime soon for lunch - once my fingernails grow back of course...

First of all, I love the concept - football on the TV's, a nice fully stocked bar, nice decor, and sushi!  5 of us showed up on a Sunday night for dinner, around 8 and it wasn't very busy at all, in fact we were one of the only people in the main dining area (they have a private booth area as well).  We ordered our miso soups, which took a fair bit of time to come out, and we honestly had to wait for about 45 minutes for our sushi to arrive.  We each only ordered 2 rolls and nothing overly complex.  I would really hate to see a sushi order during a peak busy time!  The sushi itself was decent, but for their 'specialty' rolls, I was really sad to see only 6 or 7 pieces, most of the time in a nice sushi bar, the most expensive rolls are around 8 or 9 pieces (for 9 or 10 dollars a roll I don't think that's unreasonable to ask for!)  Overall, not a great experience, but not a terrible one either - the company I was with made this a solid 3 star experience.

Food was good, but had a couple issues with service.  We used a Groupon, so they informed us we couldn't take advantage of the half price drink specials they were having.  Ok fine, next time I'll go to the bar and get a few drinks first, and close the check then get a table.  

The real issue was the price for beer stated 275 for domestics, yet when they brought the check, she had charged me 4 each.  Her explanation was that it was a premium beer (Flat Tire) so had to charge the import price, and that it was listed on the menu wrong.

We were late for an event, so even though the menu had it plainly listed as 275, right next to the name of the beer.  She wouldn't go have it fixed, so I left it up to her to get the difference, and to consider it her tip.

Going there again soon, and not leaving until they fix the menu, or charge me the stated price this time.

I just ate at Pisces for lunch and might I say, it was pretty good. I got the $11/person all-you-can-eat sushi buffet. I got the salmon, spicy salmon, avocado w/ eel, yellowtail & jalapeno, salmon w/ avocado, and tuna roll. Even though we ordered a bountiful amount of rolls, the quality of the fish was not tainted, but presentation did suffer a bit. The waitress was pretty friendly, but spoke way too quickly at times. 

All in all, it was my 2nd time going and this time, it was a better experience. 

I would say if you want to cheaply try them out, go during lunch for the $11.00 all-you-eat sushi! 

--TrizzyO_o

First time here and we loved it!
The main room goes around the corner to their booths. I loved the atmosphere in the booth, private and cozy without feeling crowded. 
Our server, Chelsea, was really great! She was upbeat and very knowledgeable about the menu. Since it was our first time we followed her suggestions and loved everyone of them-the Screaming O' roll was divine and she gave us a crash course in sake! 
We will definitely be back to try some more of their sushi rolls!
Really nice sushi and at reasonable price! I ordered the cucumber special and it lived up to the expectation :)
Love the nine to five sushi and appetizers. Nice chill environment. The service is pretty fast but they are always busy.

I come here from time to time and I always have an outstanding experience. Christine took care of me tonight and recommended this amazing cider beer that is a must try the next time you eat here. The sushi is phenomenal and so is the service! The managers are also extremely friendly. Love this place!!
This place was great! Sushi was delicious and fresh, prices are good, and the service was very good as well. Will definitely be returning for some all you can eat sushi during the day.

The $10 all you can eat sushi during lunch may seem enticing but don't be fooled... Absolutely horrible! If you want a rice roll for lunch, then come here! 2 servers for the whole restaurant during a busy lunch hour is also a mistake. When the server came back and saw me cutting some rice away so I could taste my fish, she informed me that there is a charge for not eating all of the rice!!! WHAT????? If you don't eat the whole piece or leave 4+ rolls behind, you are charged a fee. I've never heard of this- absolutely insane and just blows my mind. I will NEVER be back!

Stopped by to finally use my Groupon....based on the mixed reviews I decided to steer clear of the sushi and try an entree. I started off with fried gyoza(potstickers) and crab dumplings which were both pretty good....one served with chili sauce the other served with ponzu. The hibachi salmon was served with rice, mixed veggies(broccoli, mushrooms, onions, and zucchini) which were a little greasy due to being drowned in butter and oil. The salmon was borderline dry but had a good flavor, the rice was average as was the veggies....server Edward is the type of server every restaurant should have...very helpful, knowledgeable and patient as I am the most indecisive foodie ever, he was very honest about the menu items and didn't hesitate to give you his opinion...the other servers congregated at the bar clueless and hugging on each other(not a good look).....thank goodness they have Edward, gotta love that type of server. 3 stars for the food plus an additional star for great service from Edward..

First time here. The roll we had was ok. I was especially excited about the fresh catch menu. Or a long king salmon fNew Zealand. I have never tasted anything so delicious and buttery. It melts in your mouth. We also had a piece of Japanese kampachi (young yellowtail). I detest yellowtail and ordered for my daughter. We ended up splitting it. Rich yet fresh. We then had kinmedai ( golden eye snapper - seated with yuzu sauce. My test of a Japanese restaurant is spicy hamachi handroll with crunch. Pretty darn good.

The BEST pork belly buns in charlotte! They were perfect! The buns were soft, they give two pieces of pork belly, and not to much sauce. I tried it before and wasn't their biggest fan but that was years ago. I went yesterday and absolutely adored them! They changed the recipe and it couldn't get any better. We also tried the calamari. It was okay. Their love boat is also delicious, I love the presentation. I seriously enjoyed the entire meal and atmosphere. I can't wait to go again!

Very fresh and delish food.  Server was very helpful to the point of being chatty, LOL.  you could really tell your food was right off a boat. The booth area needs some serious decorating upgrades. They are like black caves where you may never be heard from again.  Maybe add a little color, cut out the openings so you don't risk getting a concussion? other than that, a nice night.

Sushi restaurant found in midtown near target city. Sushi did not exceed my expectations. Overpriced since your paying for location and "fancy" looking environment. Did was just decent. You could go anywhere else in the Charlotte area for better price and quality. Service was good but the reason I rate 3 is beside pricing and food quality.

Beware the rice Nazi!  The $9 all you can eat special is still a great deal, but as stated on the menu, if you don't eat all of the rice you will be charged extra.  Spicy rolls were not so spicy.  Outside of that, very good food, good selection, the atmosphere was great, our waitress was very pleasant and attentive, and the private pods were a great touch.  Full bar available also.

***Update 10/1/2010 - this is now a $12 all you can eat special!  Take off a half-star.

Love this place! Fresh sushi, excellent drinks, friendly staff; all the makings of a great restaurant. Favorite roll: Happy Endings. Favorite app: roasted Brussels. It's also a good date spot. The price point isn't outrageous and the location is centralized.
Love this place! Went for a date night and sat at the bar for dinner/drinks. Perfect. A really cool atmosphere and located close to Epicenter. Prices are comparable to other sushi restaurants.

I haven't come across a better sushi place in the Queen City in the 15 months that I've lived here. First, the atmosphere. It's an elegant party. Not a forced party, but you feel like having a good time when you walk in. The high, vaulted ceilings matched with the music and elegant decor make it a great place to hang and eat with friends. The food is seriously delicious. I haven't tried the hibachi food, but the sushi is nice and fresh. There are unique flavor combinations and cooked and uncooked options.

Lunch time all you can eat sushi(4pc rolls) for ten bucks was a pretty great deal. Friendly service. My friends and I ordered an abundant amount and none of us had a complaint about quality. Highly recommended for any group craving sushi for lunch.

3.5 Stars for Pisces.  We tried last night had the Shrimp tempura, spicy atlantic scallops, bobcat roll, dynamite roll, & a crab roll.

The food was fresh, the ambience was great & those back boothes would be fantastic for dates.

The Bobcat roll had some sweetness to it, the crab roll was pretty standard, & the dynamite roll could have used a bit more spice.  

Overall, will be going back to try the all you can eat lunch options.

I'm feeling like adding stars...well, it's also because I'm a follower of Nobu, sushi chef. He was working at Cyro's and now has transitioned to Pisces.

I'm glad Pisces added Nobu to their staff. The place was busy on a late Thursday evening: good energy, great sushi. 

The bartender was friendly and even shared a special mixed green tea drink for us to try. 

Nice job, Pisces...I'll be back...

This place was great! We went on a Monday night, so it was pretty slow. That being said, our service was great. So I can't really comment on the service when the place is busy.
The food was great, we all got sushi and it was all amazing. We also got hibachi chicken, there was a lot of chicken which was surprising; but it was good! And another member of the group also got the duck, and he absolutely loved it. We also had crab dumplings and those were great, the sauce that comes with those was unlike any I'd had with crab dumplings/Rangoon before!
For me and my boyfriend our total before tip was about 65. We got two sushi rolls, hibachi chicken, crab dumplings, and two beers (maybe three?).
The other two that were with us got two sushi rolls each, split a bottle of saki, one got the duck, and one got a handful of sashimi, their totals were about $50-55 each.
I love this area and this restaurant is definitely on the list of places to go back to!

Hey Pisces,

Please get your shit together and update the menu on your website. If not, that's fine but please tell whoever is taking to go orders to have patience when a customer orders something that isn't on the current menu. She talked to me like I was an idiot because she didn't know what I was ordering....and I was ordering off your menu. 

Your food needs great to put up with that, and it wasn't.
Good food..relaxed atmosphere. Not too pricey but not too cheap. Relaxed atmosphere. Parking is tight on the weekends. Best to take a cab.
The service was perfect and the food was amazing! We are here visiting from FL and they exceeded our expectations!

I really wanted to like this place much better. But in taking into account the price I can only give Pisces 3 stars. Was it good? Yes. Fresh? Again yes. Was it worth $20 a roll? NO.

To give a fair comparison to other Charlotte Sushi places, I ordered 2 of their signature rolls. One featured spicy jalapeños,  the other had filet mignon on top. Both were good and fresh. But both were also missing that Wow factor....that je ne sais quois.

Now the bartender was awesome, and his drinks rocked! But for 2 rolls and 2 drinks, that set me back $75 (including tip)!

To me, the best Sushi I have had in Charlotte so far still is Sushi Guru in Southpark. Their Sushi Guru Roll is TO DIE FOR! If anyone out there has other suggestions for great sushi place then pease let me know. I lived out West for 6 years so I know good Sushi.

Met up with a few friends for early dinner and then off to the theater.

The Sushi here at Pisces is fresh. So hard to find a good Sushi bar.

Went for the Dragon Roll which was fresh and crunchy. Got to admit. The there is the crunch factor when ordering rolls.

Spider Roll- Delicious soft shell crab.

Karu Roll- Spicy Tuna

Enjoyed with a glass of red wine and sake.

Happy Hour Monday- Friday from 4-6 PM. Get to try all their delicacies for a fraction of the price. 

Will be back for lunch the next time around.
The all-you-can-eat Saturday special was awesome. Good stuff! Try the garlic noodles with the shrimp sauce too Definitely going back
The A2 appetizer and the spicy garlic edamame are a MUST! The yellow submarine roll is always my favorite, and the little booths/cubbies are romantic for date night.

$10 all you can eat lunch is back for a limited time. $4 up-charge for sashimi but I highly recommend as they have beautiful fish. $10 includes all you can eat brought to your table- sushi rolls, garlic noodles (get them), fried rice AND spring rolls.

The yelp reviews were correct.  This is a very nice sushi restaurant with a nice vibe.  The wait staff is great.  Our waitress Melissa was very helpful and pleasant.  We enjoyed the saute edamame and garlic.  The sashimi tuna was fresh and melted  in my mouth. Also very tasty was the tuna,cucumber and avocado salad. They have a lunch special that I am eager to try next. 

I will definitely return to try more items on the menu.

Went basic this evening and got the crunchy salmon roll.   Good stuff.  The food is good if not great. Good beer selection. But heres the draw. The atmosphere is really great.  They have these couch type chairs that are perfect for date night. Service is fantastic and I cant give one single complaint.  Try it you will enjoy Im sure.

I recently went my first time. It's in a nice area with great restaurants nearby. I had high expectations but was a little disappointed. 

-the sushi roll was great. 
-cocktails good
-sashimi seemed less than fresh so not good 
-moco loco is over priced and was basically chicken fingers on rice stuck together by cheese. I liked the concept but less so the result 

I'd go back. But exclusively for sushi roll and cocktails.

My husband and I decided to come to Pisces last minute and were surprised that we were able to make a reservation without trouble on Saturday night. It was restaurant week last week and the menu looked incredible. To my delight, every dish on the restaurant week menu was also on the main dining menu. I think when a restaurant tries to create "features" for restaurant week, instead of highlighting great dishes from their menu, it's a great disservice to the restaurant and customers who are there to gauge the quality of the restaurant and it's food.  How else would you know if it is worth coming back to a restaurant if you can't even sample the food on their everyday menu!? 

Regardless, that was NOT the case at Pisces!! First off, the service was incredible. A girl named, Crystal, I believe was our waitress. We were seated in a place where the AC was blasting and she was really sweet and turned the temperature up slightly so I wouldn't freeze to death! She was very attentive and easy to speak with throughout dinner. 

I can't say enough good things about the sushi!!! We ordered the tuna tataki and the A2 appetizers and sushi rolls (the Screaming "O", panthers, and the big salmon roll). The Screaming "O" was hands down the best roll and the A2 (sashimi tuna) was the best appetizer. But really, pretty much ALL OF the food and wine was great. The fish was fresh and had the right fish to rice ratio with the rolls. There is nothing more disappointing than a place that skimps on the sushi and makes the rolls laden with rice. Needless to say, we will definitely coming back to have sushi and drinks at this wonderful place!!

I have been to Pisces before for cocktails in the evening and it is a great place to bring your friends for drinks.  The decor is modern (on the lounge side) and it is dimly lit, so provides a great ambiance for small groups or a date.

I came here for lunch a couple of weeks ago based on the awesome reviews. I think I had bigger expectations for this place. I got the unlimited sushi. They had a pretty good selection for only $10 a person, about 10-12 rolls to choose from. I got the spicy tuna, California, crab and shrimp tempura rolls. The rolls come out at 4 pieces. The sushi was OK. The rolls were kinda falling apart and difficult to keep together. It was made fresh, so that was a plus. 

Also with the lunch special you can get garlic noodles, fries rice or a spring roll. I got the spring roll. It was good. I also took a sneak peak at there other rolls, which you can order for lunch and/or dinner. 

Overall, if you're looking for some sushi for a great price come here. It's nothing to go crazy for, but I don't think any other Sushi places offer all you can eat for only $10 (plus they make it fresh and its not a buffet). 

Ps. They offer the lunch specials on the weekend!

I can't speak to the dinner sushi, but the $10 AYCE lunch is average at best.  Service was good and it's large, modern space, but needs some maintenance.  Our booth's faux leather was torn and pulled away all over.  

They do have a wing with about 6 super private booths, like little pods, very cool if you want privacy while dining.

We were 45 minutes late for our reservation on Valentines Day (our GPS lead us astray to the wrong location) but thankfully they still seated us. Our waiter was very attentive to our needs w/o being overbearing. The Fried Calamari app was very good, not too much breading and we enjoyed the sauce. My wife really enjoyed her Sushi Combo plate and how it was presented. She was 'stuffed' after eating. I'm not a big sushi fan and had the Steak Tataki. Although it's flank steak it was perfectly seasoned and tender. We were in and out in under an hour which was perfect since we had another engagement to get to. My wife also had a Lemon Drop and raved about that too. Very reasonably priced, we got in and out, including a 20% tip, for under $100. After reading some of the negative comments on Yelp I was a bit apprehensive about dining there but overall we had a great experience and will be going back again.

This place was really pricey and I've had better sushi then this. While the place was nice, I wasn't too thrilled about the sushi menu. There weren't a lot of options and I felt most of the options that were there were almost all the same. The lounge area where we were seated at had mosquitoes, which I thought weird. Aside from being dark and small it was kinda uncomfortable to get into. 
Not going to say what I had was bad, but it wasn't worth +$15 and it was a bit messy and all over the place when I would try to eat it. If you want really great sushi then this probably isn't the place, all you will get here is a pricey messy roll.

My favorite sushi place in the area! I don't make bold choices when it comes to sushi. I have tried, but just can't bring myself to like raw fish. However, Pisces offers really great options for vegetarians and people that like to go the cooked route with their sushi. One of my favorite rolls is the Yellow Submarine, a shrimp tempura and cream cheese roll topped with mango & eel sauce. I've also had the Taurus Veg, which is sweet potato, cucumber, avocado and mango wrapped in sesame soy paper. Added to my list of tries is the Kissy, Lil' Bastard, and Crystal Veg. All AMAZING. I love how many options I have here and how unique the flavor profiles are. The tempura fried Oreos with green tea ice cream is something I dream about still. So, so good. Although I don't order the raw fish options, I see them come out to the tables around me and they look extremely fresh and well made. You can see the chefs working at a bar right in the dining room. Great option for sushi night!

Located in the Metropolitan this place looks super swanky and chic, parking is easy enough with a large parking deck across the street. The decor is very hip and modern and you might want to wear something a bit nicer than shorts and a t-shirt for dinner lest you feel under dressed.

The sushi prices are fair and the rolls are a decent size. The rolls weren't really anything special for me and I can't really recall what they tasted like. Though I recall having a roll slathered in mayo and even with my love of mayo it was too much for me. Forgetting what the rolls taste like might be a side effect of their drink specials though. Super cheap and extremely strong well drinks are offered on the cheap on Wednesday nights, and they have different drink specials every night of the week but I've only been on Wednesdays.

The servers and hostesses are super friendly, they even gave me some free drinks and a few free rolls my second time there! The location, atmosphere, and cheap drinks are nice, however since I can't really call the sushi here very special or even remember it So I'd probably choose other options closer to home given the chance.

Came here for my bday during restaurant week. Quality of service sometimes goes down for restaurants at this time but Julian was great. We had the crab dumplings and steak Takati for appetizers. Sushi rolls: lil bastard and slamming salmon were good. Jumbo shrimp hibachi was a huge portion size.

I have been here for lunch and dinner and I can definitely say I like it a lot!!  For my entree I had hibachi shrimp both times.  Lots of plump shrimp, a good amount of veggies and I chose the fried rice, also with a cup of shrimp sauce, yum!  I have also tried the Kawaii roll, which was crab, avacado, asparagus and cream cheese in a spring roll, served open faced I think.  It was very tasty.  I also tried a sushi roll that had crab and some other stuff but tuna and tomato on top.  Tomato wasn't needed but without it the roll was delicious.

Prices are decent, service is good.  We had received some cold veggies last time and the server/manager who dropped the dishes off ran right back to the kitchen and got us some new warm ones immediately.  We would have been happy to have them reheat what was on our plate, so I thought that was a nice touch. Only thing I dislike is the parking garage, its always sooo crowded!

This place was not at all what the reviews say. First of all the sushi was not good. I got the octopus sashimi and it tasted really funky I almost puked. The salmon sashimi was not cut properly and the spicy tuna roll wasn't even spicy. Also my server brought out the check and I wasn't even finished. Maybe my expectations were high because of the reviews but I wouldn't recommend anyone eating there.

Fantastic place for lunch. $10 gets you all you can eat sushi, made to order. This is not a buffet with a lot of hands reaching into a large tray. There are about 12 or so rolls to choose from, and they come in small 4 piece rolls so you can order a bunch of different things. Also available are three kitchen items: fried rice, garlic noodles and egg rolls. And for an additional $5, you get some all you can eat nigiri options.

Don't be a jerk and order a bunch of sushi and just eat the fish out of it. They are more than happy to charge you full price if you waste the food they prepare for you.

Highly recommended, especially for lunch!

Sushi roll choices for lunch very limited.  If you like cream cheese, you are in luck.  Buffet sushi rolls are better than what I got.  Asparagus roll with an oversteamed asparagus, rice and nothing else.  Spicy tuna, just nasty.  Great location.  Need to hire an actual sushi chef.  Sam P.

Thought I'd try this place, because I always see a line out the door on most days. a friend told me that this is the best place for sushi here in Charlotte. I ordered a Spicy Tuna roll to go. I found it to be uninteresting and mediocre. It Kinda reminded me of supermarket sushi from Wegman's. Not terrible, just not great. It came with the usual wasabi and pickled ginger, and a few packets of Kikoman soy sauce (yuck).  I'll give it another try another day, maybe order something a little more complex. I won't be standing in line though, thats for sure.

Where to start...first off a lot of people were telling us to try Ru Sans. But I trusted my Yelp friends and our sons nurse and went here. We were visiting the Levine's hospital and our nurse said this was the spit. It was great. We went on a Wednesday and got there at 530. We got a bottle of wine 1/2 off and it was 1/2 off sushi rills until 6 which is why we went. Every roll we had was fantastic. Our waitress, Kaitlin, was awesome very friendly. She actually helped us order and sat and
 talked. Somehow, we got on the subject of our son, and the next thing you know she brought out a fried Oreo and vanilla ice cream desert that was..hmmm good. We had 5 sushi rolls and a bottle of wine for $55. We obviously gave her a bigger tip than normal but was still a great price for awesome food.

First of all, there is an alcohol bar but no sushi bar that you can sit at.  So calling this a sushi bar is not really accurate.  The service was so slow!  There were only 3 tables of people.  The very limited sushi menu was good but nothing out of the ordinary.  Maybe this place was good in the past or maybe we just caught them having a bad night.  Either way we won't be going back.
Great sushi!  Love to go during lunch for their Specials, made to order sushi menu.  Can't go wrong with the spicy tuna roll and the spring rolls are to die for!!!

There are some good sushi places scattered here and there around Charlotte, and this one holds its own.  That said, it's a bit pricey compared to other local sushi spots.  This is understandable given its location in the city.  

It's located in the Met so be prepared to deal with parking in the big deck.  If you're unfamiliar with the Met, it's basically an urban strip mall and since it's packed into a relatively small area there are multiple levels and a parking deck rather than big sprawling parking lots.  Ok, so back to Pisces...

We've been here a few times now and have always been happy with the service and the selections.  They have a pretty good variety of rolls to suit different tastes.  My favorites are the Screaming O and the Big Salmon.  They also have a pretty good beer and cocktail list that helps it stand out among some of the other sushi places in town.

The atmosphere is very cool and modern and fits the location well.  There is a dining room side and a bar side that feels more like a club atmosphere.  We were seated at love seats in the bar side one time and it was kind of a weird vibe at first but it ended up being really comfortable once we settled in.

Good sushi, cool atmosphere, definitely worth checking out!

I'm thrilled we chose Pisces for a girl's night meal. Their service was friendly, welcoming and not at all pushy. My friend and I ordered similarly; chilled cucumber salad with a sashimi pick and sides. We loved how the refreshing salad acted as a palate cleanser. My friend noted the dish reminded her of poke with less oil. We split the garlic edamame and roasted brussel sprouts. Both were deliciously satisfying and packing substantial flavor. Our tuna and salmon sashimi orders rounded out the pairings. Super fresh and light! This is by far my favorite sushi spot in Charlotte and can't wait to try more menu items.

Very clean environment. I love the quality of the fish and ingredients here too, nothing is of poor quality. Our waitress Chelsea was very helpful and attentive, not to mention clean and courteous. The menus seem a little small in variety, but the fact that they served Waygu was impressive to me. 
Unfortunately, I have been spoiled by "complex" sushi and though some of it was a little bland, but everything tasted wonderful. 
Definitely will visit again. A great place for meetings, dates, or by yourself.
No impressed.  While the All You Can Eat Sushi lunch special sounds appealing, it is less than that.  I'd be willing to try this place out for dinner but I won't be back for lunch.

Always enjoy the food and service here; even though, they changed their menu.  I missed some of their previous items on the menu,but always willing to try new items as well. Great place to enjoy time with friends and family. Little pricey though.
Nice atmosphere. Drinks were subpar. Sushi mediocre. Would go back for happy hour, half off sushi rolls

This is definitely a house favorite for my household. The sushi is always fresh and delicious. We always get the hornets roll! Half price bottle of wine on Wednesdays are great. All you can eat sushi during lunch. Hands down the best sushi spot in charlotte! The crab dumpling appetizer is to die for! Prices are good for the quality of food and the atmosphere is super chic.

CAUSED A TRIP TO THE ER!!!  Went for the first time for their AYCE lunch. On our way there I got on yelp and started reading the reviews. Saw one where someone said it gave them food poisoning. Like an idiot, we ignored this. BIGGEST MISTAKE! My husband got a bacterial infection from the sushi. 24 hours after eating here he started getting terrible stomach pains and diarrhea. Next day add on a fever and dehydration. The following day we're told we need to go to the ER. They put him on an IV drip to get his vitals back up because he was so dehydrated and had a 103 temp. A CT scan shows inflamed intestines. Between the ER trip and meds and everything, our sushi lunch cost us over $400! DO NOT GO HERE!!!!!
Service was great and the lunch special was incredible for what you get. We left stuffed and super happy. I'm glad we stopped in for lunch!
This was the worst sushi bar I have been too in the charlotte area. It's bad selection of sushi is matched with its service.  Please avoid if possible.  Nikko is better

This is my favorite sushi restaurant in Charlotte.  I've dined her many times and the sushi is incredibly fresh, artfully displayed and well priced.  If you're looking for an excellent dining experience, look no further.  This place is a true gem- and because it's new(er) to Charlotte the line isn't out the door.  I ate there last night and I'm already looking forward to going again.

I thought it was time for an update for Pisces. Last time I came here I understood why I loved this place so much. And since the beginning of their sushi bar, they have grown to the space next door! My place to be...the lounge.

So these are the reasons why I love Pisces:

1. If you're like me and have a hard time thinking of a drink you want, you can definitely leave it up to the bartender here. They can make something random and it will be awesome! 
2. Awesome service. I've never had a bad experience in this department.
3. Want to eat in the lounge? You sure can! 
4. They have a jelly fish tank. Yeah, A jelly fish tank.
5. Live music on Saturday nights in the lounge. 
6. TV's are always on the sports channels. (Even when Bobcats are playing against the Heats)
7. Good beers on draft.
8. (But honestly in the end it always comes back to alcohol/mixed drinks.)
9. And this place well, is the place to go for a mixed drinks with friends. That's probably the only reason I come out to bars is to try their creation and specialty drinks. Or else, I would be home drinking scotch.

So, yes. Check this place out. Anthony Hamilton did the other night, so be like a celeb (or just have fun) and watch the jellyfish go round and around the tank and get yo drink on!

Pisces is one of many Charlotte-area restaurants that suffers from the "Charlotte affect": the ability to serve average food with mediocre service and get away with it because of the barren wasteland that is the Charlotte food scene.

I really should have known judging that the place offers all you can eat sushi for $10, but this place was touted so heavily that I figured I would try it for lunch one day.

I placed my first all you can eat order and waited....and waited...and waited....after 20 minutes, I finally received my first roll. It was actually fairly tasty, but certainly not what I would call high quality sushi. I ordered my second roll and had to wait another 20 minutes. After three rolls (the third took 30 minutes to prepare), I was tired of waiting and just paid and left.

Claiming to offer all you can eat and then forcing customers to wait for unreasonably long times in between orders irks me. Either offer all you can eat or don't.

All these sushi buffets I've been to in the past few months have been solid, and this one is no exception.  Definitely the cheapest of the three I've been to -- $10 for all you can eat.  You can add $5 to your bill for nigiri, but otherwise you get a selection of 10 or so different kinds of rolls.  Rice, seaweed, and filling, very standard.  Nothing too special, but still good.  Buffet appetizers are garlic lo mein, spring rolls, and fried rice.  You can order other offerings, like special rolls, gyoza, and hibachi outside of the buffet deal.

The service was good, no complaints.  The ambiance is nice, what you'd expect out of uptown Charlotte.  All in all, the reason this gets 4 stars instead of 5 like the other reviews I've given is because the buffet has fewer offerings, and isn't quite as good.

It's still definitely worth a lunch out every now and then.  $10 is a great deal.

Visiting from San Francisco I was excited to go out. 

I did not have fun. Bad ambiance, bad food, an bad service.  

We were seated on what seemed like a communal table inches away from other parties. We asked for a booth (saw at least 3 open). They told us 'only one booth is left and we have to save it. Ok fine.

We were served cat-foody sushi with hard dry rice. Grosser than grocery store sushi. Good thing the portions were TINY because I couldn't choke down any more. 

Overall the waitress was rude and stupid. She brought me the wrong thing once and NEVER brought my sauce. We asked to split the check and the idiot brought out two checks alright....she charged us both for the whole table! Oh and your TIP IS AUTOMATIC- I had to tip over 30% where no tip was deserved. When I'm spending my money I want to enjoy myself. 

One star because I didn't get food poisoning.

Sushi is fine - a little too much rice, but it is okay.  

Service is good, but the parking situation is AWFUL.  

I would go back... but not in my top few places.

This is a great date spot, but be ready to drop $100 for three rolls to split. The sushi is delicious... My best recommendation would be the Bobcats roll (and I don't usually like eel sauce). Other suggestions: Scorpio & Metro. Overall atmosphere is upscale trendy and they take reservations, even Saturday nights. Bonus: Wednesday wine bottles are half off.

The lunch waitress made my first experience my last with her lack of time management skills. I ordered  three different sushi's under the all-you-can-eat lunch special. With only an hour for lunch I was expecting this to be a quick and tasty experience, however her 10-20 minute interval table check made it impossible to enjoy the tasteful sushi . When I expressed  my issue with the manager as far as the waitresses time management skill, she over talked me and my guest and condescendingly explained how the waitresses are all taught to read the menu and check back with customers and a list of other things her waitress failed to do this time around. We noticed during our dining that customers seated after us were served in a speedier fashion than ourselves. We were not looking for empathy or a free meal, however we were just offering the heads up that staff may need to be reminded what's expected of them. The owner ended up explaining to us that he was very sorry for the experience and he holds every employee to higher expectations than what was shown today. After this I rather take my chances elsewhere.

Bad sushi to go. Less than 10 miles from the restaurant and attempted consuming immediately.

Did not stay down long. It smelled fishy when I took the lid off, I should have stopped then.

Our dinner was very nice, although we had a little mishap with one of the rolls the manager did everything he could to make it right and more. All the staff was very pleasant and kind, we would recommend this place!

Since I'm a Pisces, I feel a natural pre-disposition to like this place. I got to check the place out on my birthday (March 5th for any inquiring minds) and was so happy with my dinner experience.

Pisces is right across the shopping center containing Marshall's Best Buy and Trader Joe's so you'll have to deal with the gnarly parking garage. I suggest driving up to a higher level, less congestion and speed racers.

The night of my birthday was half-price cocktails (*praise hands emoji*) so I ordered a martini that had pomegranate in it. Forgive me, I completely forget the official name of the drink but it was delicious and smooth. My best friend ordered the cucumber sake martini that was also delicious with a nice cucumber finish.

I ordered the taurus veg and panthers rolls. Not only were they both colorful and pretty to look at, they were so fresh and delicious. No joke, I inhaled both rolls.

The waitstaff was incredibly patient and kind. The manager even came by to check in our meal and wished me a happy birthday! The interior is smaller than I was expecting but creates a nice intimate feel and there is a funky jellyfish tank that you can stare at for hours.

Looking for good sushi and cocktails? stop at Pisces!

We tried Pisces again, and I hate to drop my rating, but the service was pretty terrible AGAIN.  Oddly enough, the hostess was great, the waitress was great at first, and the manager even came by the check on us.  However, the minute we got our food, the fella ordered a glass of wine, and waited.... and waited... and waited.  We were sitting about 15 feet from the bar, so we saw the glass sitting there, but our waitress - and all the other waitresses - seemed to disappear.  We could see a few people gathered around it at the bar, but no one was delivering it.  This whole time, I was also out of water.  After 20 minutes, the fella finally got up and actually got it himself (after confirming with the bartender that it was his).  Sadly, the good food just doesn't make up for such consistently inconsistent service.

I'm a sushi lover so I could probably eat sushi every single day and be happy. With that being said, I've tried a lot of sushi restaurants. Pieces was great, but it wasn't astonishing. Our appetizer was okay... I feel indifferent about it. The rolls very fresh and very tasty. Although I don't have any true complaints, there was nothing about Pieces that truly stood out to me. Nothing that screamed, "I'm a five star sushi restaurant!!" Don't get me wrong, the sushi is very good. But I'm a sushi snob, and I've had better.

Pisces had great appetizers (I had the pork gyoza and pork belly buns), but I wasn't impressed with my entrée - hibachi chicken. The garlic noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the chicken and vegetables weren't anything special. Someone who doesn't like sushi would probably enjoy this restaurant for happy hour rather than dinner.

My fiance and I ventured to Pisces for the first during this year's restaurant week. We made reservations for Friday night at 730pm. When we arrived we had to wait at the bar for our table (which was a bit odd due to our aforementioned reservation). After 10 minutes or so, we were seated close to the sushi bar. I would have preferred dining in the more cozy alcoves, being out in the open (and in the middle of the restaurant) was a bit loud and quite cold (turn off the AC, it's not that warm out!) 

We decided to go with the restaurant week menu and added a couple of other items as well. We both had a glass of chardonnay and shared a bottle of nigori sake. Both were very good and complimented our sushi. We also liked the fact that the wine was included in our $30 meal. We ordered the crab dumplings and nawaii rolls for appetizers, both were incredibly flavorful. We also boldly ordered the little miniature crabs (I can't remember their name) and both found them surprisingly good (with the perfect amount of salt). For our entrees, we decided to order two sushi rolls each and a couple of pieces of nigiri. The fish was fresh and I appreciated that none of the rolls were drenched in sauce (as so many of them seem to be, particularly from other establishments). We particularly enjoyed the Slammin' Salmon roll. It had the perfect amount of salmon and cream cheese. 

In terms of service, it was fantastic. Our waitress was personable and checked in on us the perfect number of times. And even though the restaurant was pretty crowded, we didn't have to wait long for our food (always a plus!)

Overall we had a great experience and a fun date night. We will definitely be returning to Pisces in the future!

I was here a couple of months ago from NYC and loved the sushi and the happy hour. I made it a point to come back on this trip, and it was even better than the first time, thanks to our wonderful server, Andrea. She was so sweet and so helpful and just and gave us SPECTACULAR service. I really hope next time she is our server, again! You should ask for her, if you come here!
All the rolls were cold and kinda disappointing. Also my cat died. Charlotte is ok. Why do all my friends hate me? The sushi was okay though.

I was on vacation from Fort Lauderdale and caught a craving for sushi and this place showed up in my recommendations. The sushi was spectacular, I usually order 3 or more rolls which always costs me $40 so I thought it was awesome that I had the option to get all you can eat sushi for $10. Everything I ate tasted so fresh, my servers name was Andrea and she made my experience so awesome. She knew everything on the menu, any question I asked her she answered without any hesitation. The service was so warm and hospitable. If I ever come back to Charlotte I will be sure to come back and ask for Andrea!
Fast service, ordered the desperado roll with a miso soup, sushi tasted good, and waitress was really nice. I would recommend trying it if you're looking for a sushi place in Charlotte.

I have only been here for lunch.  But I come often, because it's one of the best places near Uptown.

The lunch buffet is made-to-order and all-you-can-eat.  The only stipulation is a limit on the number of items each person can order at once, and a requirement that you have to eat everything.  It's often not a problem!

Unlimited garlic noodles (along with things like spring roles, fried rice) are part of the options.  They can be hit-or-miss, but when they're good, it's hard to get enough.

Huge variety of sushi options.  Plenty for vegetarians and non-fish-fans.  Try the crunchy rolls.

This is probably my number go to spot for sushi in Charlotte. They have the best lunch special for sushi! For $11 you can get all you can eat sushi plus fried rice, spring rolls, garlic noodles and other appetizers.
The face a good selection of specialty rolls on the all you can eat lunch special my favorite is the spicy crab salad or the bagel roll which is salmon and cream cheese.  Today we also had a tuna roll that tasted as if it was caught this morning.
There sushi always taste very fresh and the spring rolls are fried to perfection and are always nice and crispy! 
That atmosphere is very nice  make sure you check out the jelly fish tank! The drinks have great names also we had the Cardi B wich was their take on a Moscow mule. If as pretty good and went great with good music playing In the background. I also recommend this as a date spot.

I went here with two friends of mine. The sushi was a little pricey for Charlotte, but tasted amazing. The menu was classy and had lots of options and they were happy to modify the food per our requests. 

There are two things people should know for going to this place. First off, it has an urban chic style with a dark and misty feel, which can be fun and exciting for some people but not everyone's cup of tea. The other is that the Booths are awkwardly shaped to be artsy, but for people 6 feet tall and above, you will hit your head coming in or out...

Pisces Sushi is the best sushi that I have had in Charlotte. My husband and I tried it out for the first time during restaurant week and we were both wowed. The lunch buffet is not to be missed if you are lucky enough to work nearby. The waitstaff was super friendly and offered great suggestions. This is a great spot for a date night or a casual meal with friends. Definitely check it out!

I rarely give a 3 Star review may I add. I do love their sushi, even though it's slightly over priced. I came for the lunch special. The sushi was next to none with the fish but a ton of rice which I hate. It was good but they could use more fish. They are VERY serious about "order what you can eat". The waitress literally came off threatening about explaining how it worked and was so serious about it. It also took me a long time between sushi orders to get my sushi when the restaurant really wasn't busy. I will still come here but they need some improvements for sure to stay relevant towards all the other amazing sushi places I've been too. Sushi was too ugly to take and lost a pict

$10 All You Can Eat sushi?  Yep!

My husband and I came in for the lunch sushi special.  This is a-la-carte- so much better than a buffet!  You can choose whatever rolls you want off the menu that has about 15 choices.  You can also get garlic noodles, fried rice and spring rolls.  For $2 you can add soup and salad.  The garlic noodles were awesome and so were the spring rolls!  We didn't try the rice.

This is definitely worth the price, and tastes fresh.  Service is also fast!  We enjoyed it.
food is solid and affordable.  The service is very slow, making this place almost impossible to go to.  We got seated quickly for lunch but ordering, waiting on food and paying took forever.

We came in to celebrate my birthday. Excellent sushi excellent service. We had Kellyanne tonight and she was phenomenal!  Ask for her if you go in! So far this is one of the better sushi joint in Charlotte, we will come back!

I had a chance to check out Pisces recently and was very happy with it. With the all you can eat deal, I had a chance to sample a lot of sushi. I like the fact that the rolls were small in this instance. The all you can eat is now 11.95, hate I didn't get there when it was 9.  From Nigiri we had the sake (salmon) and maguro (tuna) and from the rolls we had the asparagus roll, tempura maki roll, bagel roll, crab salad roll, california roll, spicy crab salad roll, unagi roll, we also had the garlic noodles and an order of fried rice. All were delicious and fresh. My favorite was the bagel roll and spicy crab salad. I heard a rumor from two Charlotte natives that this was their favorite sushi place because it is the only one they know of in Charlotte that gets daily seafood deliveries, don't know about that, but it sure is good and tastes fresh! Good, all you can eat sushi...I'm down!

My favorite place to have me some okinomiyaki, pan-fried dumplings, fresh mango/cucumber salad, and some rolls. I used to come here a lot, and I mean a lot! 

But this place is a bit pricey :(  So I haven't been here for a while. 

But I definitely will be back for some more! I like the all the waitstaffs here - they were attentive and friendly. It makes me forget about the prices and all (b/c of the yummy food and friendly ppl). Great atmosphere, trendy place to hang out.  Definitely a place to check out and dine!

It's not quite in the territory of your favorite cheap hibachi place in college but it hits the spot none the less. I like getting the all you can eat nigiri for 15 dollars. They always get a great sear on the salmon hibachi, it's expensive but for me it's worth it. 

It's obviously a quantity over quality thing here but that's not really a bad thing as "all you can eat sushi" is a dangerous phrase when done poorly lol. Never been disappointed here.

Yum! Came here while visiting from out of town and was looking for some delish sushi to start off our Saturday. Pisces did not disappoint! We started with some house ginger salads- loved the homemade dressing! The sushi was fresh and flavorful- I had the rainbow, metro, and a california roll to top things off. My friends liked theirs as well. Overall, pretty cool scene and good sushi. We had a booth in the back that was tucked into a wall which would be perfect if you're looking for something a little quieter.

I love sushi and sashimi, so let me say I am pretty experienced in trying sushi restaurants.

I had the all you can eat sushi/sashimi lunch today.  $14 per person for a fair selection of rolls and nigiri.  

I requested a few rolls and nigiri and asked the server if they could serve them without rice.  The server checked with management and told me they could not take off the rice.  Not only could they not take off the rice but they would charge me extra for not eating the rice!  Are you &@(/-)@! kidding me?

The sushi rolls had 10% seafood and 90% rice .... This is not acceptable for anyone, unless you just don't know better or don't like sushi.

The minuscule amount of seafood inside the roll was fresh and tasted good, hence the two stars.

Bottom line.... not worth the time or energy to find an elusive parking space to go to Pisces.

The $10 all you can eat lunch special is what my coworkers and I love coming in for. The fried rice is perfect, not too greasy. Vegetable spring rolls are addicting. My go to lunch special sushi is the eel avocado. Never fails. Ambiance is nice too.

Was here recently and loved it!  Not too expensive (same prices as Enso etc).  Go on a Monday when they have 1/2 price bottles of wine!  I love the chic atmosphere, in the back there are these honeycomb type booths that are private and make you feel like you are on a spaceship.  The staff is super sweet and gave us free shots of something fuity and delicious when we were there.   Love it!!!

I know yelp wants me to write more, but: 

Go for the all you can eat lunch buffet. The value is the same as buying a house for the cost of a car. 

Go, now...
Great sushi! Great place for a date...fun booths!

After dealing with the parking purgatory that makes up parking at the Metropolitan, I was primed to have an unpleasant experience at Pisces. However, after the quick seating and explanation of the made-to-order lunch, I was happily satisfied!

First off, let it be known that to call this sushi lunch a "buffet" is a misnomer. While many buffets conjurer up visions of dueling tongs among heated troughs, every item on the lunch buffet is made to order. For $12. That is ridiculousness.  

Not only does this result in freshly made sushi, noodles, and spring rolls, but it also saves you the precious calories of having to walk to a buffet line--they bring the food to you. Each person can order 10 items at any given time, but you may have to pay for any wasted food, so do try to contain yourself.

So, what are some of the top picks? 
- The garlic noodles are simple in their amazing: imagine those thick chow mien noodles lightly fried with garlic. It sounds good, but tastes even better. 

- The spring rolls: holy cow, these are fired to flaky perfection and served with a sweat and spicy dipping sauce. What is not to like?

- Fried rice: I am a sucker for cuttings of veggies, egg, and rice fried with soy sauce. Just be careful not to fill up on the carbs. Hold out for the main course!

- Frankly, all of the copious rolls that I had were delicious. The best part is that they do NOT pad the roll with lots of rice to trick your stomach into being full. A thin respectable layer of rice and seaweed is the only think between you and your filling of choice. 

- While I love that they have multiple veggie options: asparagus, avocado, cucumber, and tamago (egg), they are in need of a One Veggie Roll. One Roll to bring them all together and in the seaweed bind them (LoTR? Anyone?). 

- The non-veggie rolls are also solid, ranging from the spicy, the cream cheesed, and the fried. I don't tend to eat fish, but I did (secretly) enjoy my bagel roll!

Bottom line, if you are jonesing for a LOT of freshly-made sushi, come here for lunch!

Pisces is one of my favorite spots in town for sushi for a variety of reasons. Some of them are: 

- Bob the Bartender
- The Screaming "O" Roll
- Tuna bruschetta
- Garlic noodles
- Bob the Bartender

Very japanese menu with the real stuff and fish flown from all ofer the world. It's all about the textures, the umami combinations and a knowledgeable staff.

The place has a lounge and a restaurant. It wasn't really vibrant when we went but it may be better on a friday night.

My colleagues and I often go here for their AYCE lunch special. Can't go wrong with a $12 AYCE lunch (including soup and salad), $10 only if you want sushi and app items. They have some good rolls, none are specialty, but above the basic.
AYCE Sushi I recommend trying: 
- Crunchy Roll
- Spicy Tuna
- Spicy Salmon
- Eel Avocado
- Eel Cucumber
- Tuna Avocado

AYCE Kitchen items:
- Pork Gyoza
- Veg Spring Roll

You must eat all or it's $1 per left over roll!!

One of my colleagues swears by the hibachi plate. He always gets that when the rest of us pig-out on sushi. ha ha

Ambiance - trendy, dim lighting, would be good for dinner date or something "special". Have been going with the hubs for dinner and it gets crowded. Might spot a Panthers player, as some live within the condo complex!

Usually I would give this place a 4, but since my last visit (haven't been there since) I only give it a 2 and here is why:

We had our usual lunch pow-wow and were ready to pay. We all paid separate, which we never had a problem before. This time when our server (also the bartender) returned our cards / checks I've noticed one of my colleagues card missing. The check showed that she had ran it, so he did give it to her (checked on name on receipt too, in case she had ran a card twice or something). We brought it to her attention and at first swore that she had returned it. She even said "i ran it, so you can just sign it"...uhm hello? It's a bright red bank of america card, we noticed it was not on the black check booklet. She attempted to look around our table - as we lost it. Maybe, but before putting it to her attention, we (3 of us) had checked thoroughly. The server walked back and forth the bar / register, re-tracing her steps. looking on the ground, nothing. Probably 10 minutes go by. I even went to other tables which had received checks and were left on the table to see if it was tucked in with those. nothing. Another 5 minutes go by, what I believe the manager came over - but she didn't introduce herself. We just told her what happened and she also just looked on the ground using her cellphone as a flashlight.....20mins in, my colleague is ready to call his bank to cancel the card and we had told it to the server and the "manager". Nothing. Sever went back to the bar for a bit as the "manager" looked on the ground around our table. They were both apologetic, but 20mins in, I would have expected some kind of action, even give my colleague the meal ($8+soda) for free in lieu of the hassle and having to get a new card (it was Friday, so he would have had to wait till Tuesday, if the bank can overnight it, perhaps even for a fee - a new card sometimes cost $10 depending on your bank).

Server returns with the card...she apologized for the hassle. We were all relieved. I had asked where she had found the card, apparently she had THROWN IT OUT WITH THE DUPLICATE PAPER................................... THROWN IT OUT! eh ok. then she said "oh you don't need to tip me". WHAT? that's all you can offer? Call me a snooty NYer, but i would have given my colleague a free meal at least, if not a coupon for a free meal next time (if he decides to go back). For the hassle - work lunch, 30mins delay for 3 people to return to work.....i dunno, something. 

Sure enough, I haven't returned since then. Maybe i'll check it out again, hoping the server / bartender is not there. Not sure, but that experience just doesn't sit well for me. Too bad, it was a good deal and delicious, but service belongs to the experience as well.

4 stars for the food
0 stars for guest experience
averages to 2 stars.

I brought all my friends with me to check out this sushi bar. It's very lounge-like. However, we went on the weekend-- so we didn't have time to enjoy the $14 dollar all you can eat sushi... which I would have appreciated to know very very much! 

I'll definitely come back during the week with my boyfriend. Love this place!

I love everything about Pisces...the service, the location, the food quality. We've been many times and always have a really nice experience. The owner is very attentive & always stops by our table. 

If you haven't yet, try the Kawaii rolls...amazing, and the Crazy roll is surprisingly crazy good. They have a nice wine list with plenty of options and a fun selection of martinis! Go!
No more all you can eat sushi!! Food is ok, but that was their big selling point for me. Probably won't be going back.

I was craving some sushi, so I came on yelp to assist me since I'm not a native to Charlotte.  I missed the lunch buffet, but was still very satisfied with my Dynamite roll. My husband had the Jumanji roll, and we shared the pineapple rice with our kids! It was a nice little spot for our lunch & convient parking was right across the street! I enjoyed my meal & plan on coming back very soon!

First time in Charlotte and me and my husband enjoyed diner here. The fried calamari was great and the drinks where on point. Sushi was good and the presentation was pretty and chic. Will visit again next time we are in Charlotte.
I Love Pisces! I go there for lunch all the time and the sushi always tastes amazing! The place looks very cool.

I can understand why this place is popp'n: because of the area.

Food was mediocre... or maybe I'm being too nice, I thought the food was flavorless. I had way better at RuSans! High priced sushi because of the area... not because its a "Omg, the food here is AMAZING!"

Must say this place is a solid choice for me when I have a hankering for some sushi.  It's a solid alternative to Enso because I don't feel like I have to get dressed up and the costs are a little less.  I also think it's a fairly good romantic place to go if you can get the little cove bench seating in the back.  My girlfriend and I have been lucky both times to be able to sit there and it makes you feel secluded and like you're dining privately.  If you are here on a date, get the love boat!  It's $50 for 2 people and just a cute approach to a romantic dinner.

Such a good lunch special. All you can eat rolls for $11! It's quick and really good. Nothing fancy but simple and fresh. They have the best garlic noodles I've ever had and people love the veggie spring rolls too!
The owner is a young guy, who is super nice and friendly. We witnessed him handle a table of jerks next to us and he did it beautifully, with patience and professionalism. I am always up for supporting small businesses especially when the owner is great, More reason to come back!
Great management.  Waited 10 minutes for the server to come to our table and manager bought a round of drinks and dessert for us
I like the all you can eat sushi, it was good. The service did lack a bit during MY visit to this location. But over all I enjoyed myself with my friend.

This is a solid good eat if you are searching for fresh tasting sushi. I ordered the screaming "O" roll and the cucumber special roll as well as the seared tuna in ponzu sauce appetizer. All of them were very good, especially the seared tuna. The staff are very accommodating too, our waitress was a little forgetful but her sweet personality made up for it. The reason they are not getting a higher rating is because we felt as though the table could have been more clean. The surface of the table seemed very sticky...just one of my pet peeves.

Thank you so much Pisces for making my boyfriends birthday special!!! They accommodated our table of 11 very well and everyone had a great time. I don't normally like sushi, but this place has changed my mind! With vegan and vegetarian and gluten free options, this is the place for everyone! I am so thankful for their wonderful service and food and absolutely will be back. They catered to everyone's dietary needs and answered our questions professionally and enthusiastically. I'm not really into seaweed and they have options for that too ;). Overall a great experience. The parking was also very easy as there's a deck right across the street! Thank you to the wonderful staff and chefs.
Nice chill spot.. wasn't busy so it was good I enjoyed my sushi. Nothing to crazy so good..

Highlights
- Upscale sushi bar
- Sushi selection and quality is a 5 star
- Hibachi filet mignon is a 3 star. Meat was good but missing on overall flavor.
- Great cocktails
- Decent wine list
- It is expensive, unless you go during happy hour
- Parking is street or the deck

I enjoyed the sushi.  Place is a solid 4 star overall.  I would recommend going during happy hour (Mon - Fri 4-6). Sushi is 1/2 price then.

We are adding this spot to our list of "go-to" spots! Very nice atmosphere, sushi was excellent, drinks were great and service was stellar! Even the plating was a delight! Hats off to the sushi chefs! Soooo like why wouldn't we keep coming back? Great date night spot.....so grab your SO and enjoy a great dining experience!

Wanting to try Pisces for a while, I finally made the 3 mile trek.  In general, I had a good experience. 

Decor - The space is cool.  It's basically an open space with some private booths in the back.  We were offered the last private booth, which we accepted, only to find out the two of us had to sit next to each other facing a wooden divider.  We lasted about 2 minutes before we asked to be re-seated.  It was just a touch too weird with the divider 18 inches in front of your face.  Thankfully, the restaurant was not overly crowded and we were able to be reseated.  

The service was very attentive and provided for a great experience.  +1 for our server. 

The sushi was pretty good, albeit standard, across the board.  The white tuna nigiri was delicious.  However, there was one odd item which we ordered - Salmon Toro.  Toro is a Tuna with a high amount of fat in it, making it buttery.  We tried the salmon toro hoping for the same taste.  What we found was the regular salmon was more buttery, and the Salmon Toro was rather fishy tasting....  We'll skip that when we go back.  

All in all, the food was good, quality service and pretty reasonable prices.  Definitely check it out.
Great service and atmosphere. I got a rainbow roll and it was good!

An all-you-can-eat sushi lunch for just $11? It sounded too good to be true, until I dropped in at Pisces on a recent weekday to see for myself. What I discovered is one of the best lunch values in Charlotte, served up at an unassuming sushi restaurant in the Metropolitan. 

Yes, for just ELEVEN DOLLARS, you can enjoy as many sushi rolls, Nigiri, or Tuna pieces as you can handle, along with fried rice, garlic noodles and spring rolls. And if that's not enough, you can add a Miso Soup and Ginger Salad for just $2 more. We enjoyed a delicious order of California, Yellowtail and Tempura Shrimp rolls, then mixed in a Spicy Salmon roll on round two. Service was prompt and friendly, and there are a fair number of local craft brews on tap, along with saki and wine. 

A recent expansion has nearly doubled the restaurant's seating capacity, but their amazing lunch offer ensures the place fills up quickly by 12:15. So get there early, grab a table, and enjoy what may the best sushi deal in the Queen City!

Meh. I came in for lunch one day and ordered from the menu. My sushi roll was fine, but nothing too special. Everyone else seemed to be enjoying the $11 all you can eat sushi. If you're looking for unlimited sushi, this would be a good lunch stop.
Love the $10 lunch special! They serve only simple rolls but I like them. Along with the garlic noodles and yum yum sauce: perfect lunch!

Some fantastic specials everyday, is one reason why Pisces has easily become one of my favorites in Charlotte, and I haven't been here two weeks yet! My new friend took here in my first weekend in town, and now I'm kinda hooked on Pisces. Also, Pisces is my sign ha ;) 

We went on a Saturday for a late lunch and it was packed. Thankfully, we were seated right away. I got the Chicken and Shrimp Hibachi entree, which was served with garlic noodles (extra $1) along with miso soup and ginger salad. Also, we had an order of Crab Dumplings to share, and Holy Moly, those were ridiculously delicious! 

Pro-tip: Check out their made to order all-you-can-eat Sushi lunch for $11.00/person: with 26 Sushi rolls options (all rolls are 1/2 of a full roll: aka 4 pieces-which you can't get it to-go btw) and kitchen items like fried wonton strips, fried rice, garlic rice, veg. spring rolls and fried pork. However:
- Keep in mind you might be fined for all-you-CAN'T-eat-Sushi if you wasted too much food, as they're trying to avoid food wastage. 
- Nigiri cost $5 extra.

... And for those who doesn't know about the specials and lazy to find out, here's the scope:
Mondays: Half price wine glasses.
Tuesday: Half price sake.
Wednesday: Half price wine bottles.
Thursday: Half price cocktails.
And it gets better,
- Daily: $4 Sapporo drafts.
- Weekday Happy hour 4pm-6pm Sushi & apps


Sadly, Pisces Sushi Bar is closed on Sundays.
Pisces, I'll be regular!

Four and Half Yelps

Nice spot! Nice ambiance, great food (I had the Wagyu Cheeseburger, Calamari, Screaming "O" Sushi, and the Fried Philly sushi roll -- the two rolls to go :) ), and friendly, helpful, and attentive staff. Will definitely go back! Especially to try some more of those sushi rolls our waitress so highly recommended (it was really hard for me to only choose two).

What a great lil place in Metropolitan Place.  We went on Sunday night, and there is ample space and no wait for seating.  Oh, did I mention half off wine... Word UP!  The Sushi menu is about Par, and has all the regular rolls ya plan on at a sushi place.  They also had some interesting veggie rolls that I've never seen before and were very tasty!  One thing, the wait to get our ordered food was a tad long considering the amount of people that were in the restaurant.  I'll definitely go back though, great atmosphere with an interesting decor!  Check it out if your looking for some fish n' rice!

Delicious as usual! Great service, great energy,  great food. This will forever and always be one of my favorite sushi restaurants. I tried the garlic spinach this time, in addition to my usual Aries Roll and Garlic noodles and it was a party in my mouth! Can wait until next time!

Great sushi!  Great service. Great atmosphere. They have real nice private seating that you should try out for date night. 
   Also - the 100%best shrimp sauce !

I was hesitant to try Pisces after reading the luke warm reviews on yelp, but I'm really glad I did.  First of all, the interior and ambiance is elegant, but comfortable.  We were seated in a booth in the back and tended to immediately by our server.

We ordered a handful of rolls to share for the table which were delicious and fresh tasting.  All of us kept saying how impressed we were with the quality and flavor profiles.  Top that off with an affordable bottle of white and we had ourselves a lovely evening.  Thanks Pisces!

I went there to try the Sushi. For the price it definitely wasn't worth it. We had a few OK rolls but this wouldn't be my place of choice for Sushi. I've heard Pisces serves other dishes that are quite good but have yet to try them. 

I'd be up for trying something else other than their Sushi to give the place a fair shot.

Only came here for the cocktails! The decor is really nice and they have some cool booths that are cut into the wall. I love it because the setting was so intimate.

Anyways, I sat at the bar and tried these drinks:

Queen Amidala: This is the first drink I've ever had with olive oil but I didn't mind because it was such a pretty pink color. That being said I wouldn't order it again. It was just okay 3/5

Smoking Hot Stepmom: If you like spicy drinks you should definitely try this! It had muddled jalapeño and I loved it. 

Wassup B: This drink is very yummy and the coolest part is that it is topped with wasabi foam. If you order it, prepare your upper lip to get a little tingly. 4/5

I would definitely come back here. They also have a happy hour from 4-6pm which is half off sushi.

Pricey. Sushi rolls weren't all that. Had a couple of different rolls from this place multiple times and nothing stood out. However garlic noodles were awesome. They have all you can eat buffet for lunch but the ordering style was annoying, since the server had to come check on you to place your order ...then you have to wait for it to be made and sometime you sit there waiting forever and the server is no where to be found.  Hello? It's lunch time. Don't you know some people have a time limit on their lunch break? Nothing spectacular about this place other than it's in a hip location and good for younger crowds on weekends. Decors are nice but I wouldn't wow my friends and families from out of town with their sushi. Go to Rusans, decent priced and way better flavor in their foods.  

Last time I was there at Pisces for a friends bday, two of my friends made a mistake and ordered the crab salad thinking it would be something awesome considering the price! When it came out, it was nothing but shredded imitating crab meats (wtf?) mixed with tons and tons of cucumber, so flavorless! Anddddd it tasted like something a kid could make.  They both didn't even want to finish it. Seriously not impressed.

Fantastic food and drinks. The waitress provided excellent suggestions and off-menu selections to hit our favorite fish cut flavors. The salmon sashimi is amazingly fresh and buttery, and the dragon roll very flavorful.

Really good sushi!  We have become sushi snobs if you will.  We are on a mission to try all sushi restaurants in Charlotte.  They have such cool booths to eat in in Pisces.  They are a bit above average in price but I think that is due to location most likely.  Cosmo roll was our favorite, such unique presentation.  Really yummy cocktails too!

I took my wife here for her birthday based on recommendations from acquaintances. I was rather disapointed, the choices are limited and what we had while good was not great. The atmosphere was  lacking it had the feel of trying to impress me but missed all around. I felt on top of other guests. I don't expect to go back.

First: I don't eat sushi.. so this review is strictly about the other food items.  Pro: spicy edemame is delicious.  Gyoza A+, Miao soup A+.  Hibachi is good, a little bland but, they give you a decent amount of chicken (maybe too much) but it's good for the $16 price tag.  Con: it always smells like a musty bathroom to me in there.. it always seems to be as I'm leaving too.  The "Lounge" area is nice to sit at, however, if you're there for a meal and they sit you at the couch, it's not very comfortable to eat.. so ask to be reseated.

My nieces first time having Sushi!!!!! 

This was my second time visiting Pisces. I brought my niece along to try sushi for the first time. She's new to the Queen City. From my understanding, Indiana has limited options when it comes to food. 

We arrived around 11:30AM before the lunch crowd. My niece browsed the menu. She asked a few questions then proceeded to order. The waitress and I were stunned when she ordered the Tuna Roll...Tuna??? What??? Yes!! Go for it!! 

Here's another first!!! My niece also used chopsticks. She struggled a few times, but never gave up! I was so proud of her!! The sushi was WONDERFUL!!! She definitely enjoyed every bite!! 

Our waitress was patient and kind.... thank goodness. I look forward to building even more precious memories as a new Aunt/mentor. So thank you Pisces for taking care of us today! This has been a unforgettable experience!!!
The all you can eat lunch is gone!  But the quality of the lunch experience isn't diminished 1 bit.

My friend and I just had a wonderful experience after a problem at Pisces. We were enjoying our meal and wine when there was an issue with a sushi roll. The staff, manager and, I'm assuming, owner were extremely apologetic and accommodating. They fixed the problem then you took several additional steps to make sure the problem was taken care of. This says a lot to a customer! We will be back.

I've only been for lunch for the all you can eat. 
The service is very slow, BUT that is because all the sushi is fixed to order. Nothing sits out with people grabbing or setting tongs on top of the food after handling them. Not all rolls are available on the all you can eat menu, but I'm not complaining, the food that is on the menu is great! They even have inari, whish is difficult to find sometimes. I recommend you try one.
For all you can eat lunch, you get to pick up to 10 items at a time per person. once you get you items, don't hesitate to order more as long as you know you will be able to eat the majority of it without being wasteful.
