I wish I could rate this place 6 stars. The ambience as soon as you walk in had a upscale bar type feel to it. You somewhat get this feeling that you are going to have to sit out with everyone which was quite loud. The waitress took us around back to a secluded booth where my date and I could converse in piece and enjoy the delicous food. Everything was absolutely phenomenal from the get go. Our server Kevin was not only knowledgeable of items on the menu but very personable. My date and I enjoyed the atmosphere and food selection. If im not mistaken the manager came to check on us. This is not the "Oh hey are you ok...ok good". You can tell she genuinely cared about how are evening was going. I have literally tried sushi from here to Timbuktu and this is by far the best sushi. We also tried the Saki "Leechi" which was delicious. A bit pricey but well worth it. Again, my date and I thoroughly enjoyed our evening at Pisces and will be back very soon!
Can't beat the all you can eat sushi during lunch for $10! The spring rolls, spicy crab, shrimp tempura, spicy tuna, spicy hamachi, and eel roll are some of the options included.

Took the family of 5 for dinner. Place was empty @6 on a Tuesday which was nice. Seated promptly and server was attentive early in the process. She was very knowledgeable and offers several recommendations which is always appreciated. She lost some momentum getting drinks to the table and getting an answer to a "nuts allergy" question we had for on of the appetizers at the table. Overall, I thought she was good. A little slow at times but good overall. We ordered several sushi rolls , soup, and a couple of restaurant week dishes. Everyone loved the sushi and the crab filling appetizers. Spicy garlic edamame were good but I think I prefer plain old edamame. Chicken habachi was good and also very good portions. The sushi girl at the table liked it but didn't love it. Thinks there's a better sushi place in the area which I won't name. Overall, I thought it was good and would return. If you haven't been it's worth a visit.

This was our third time eating at Pisces, 2nd lunch time all you can eat 'limited sushi'  First 2 experiences were amazing.. quick, friendly and DELICIOUS!! 

Thought this one was going to be different because we got there at 1230 (lunch time rush)  hostes said it would be a 25 min wait, so we asked if we could sit at the bar, since we only get an hour for lunch.  She said yes but it all depends how busy the servers are when they will get to us.  That was weird. But we sat patiently and a very helpful young lady helped us with ease.  Got our order under way and was very quick about it.  

Our visit was pretty great as usual and we shouldn't have doubted it even one second.  

The best Sushi place I have eaten at in Charlotte.  Fish is super fresh, the flavors are amazing. And it looks like they may be expanding, which they should because they are so good!!

My favorite place in Charlotte. I've been here more than I can remember. I love it here. The atmosphere is cool. The staff is awesome. And the food is top notch. I love sushi and their lunch buffet is excellent. It's always fresh and they have great selections and a great value. I've also been here for dinner and for drinks and even hung out at the new lounge. I just love it there. If you haven't been there, you should definitely give it a try. A+++'s all around.

Great place for sushi in Charlotte-especially if you are looking for gluten free. The menu is clearly marked with GF items and they have a separate prep area. Just make sure you tell the server what your needs are

Tonight was my first time at Pisces, and I have nothing to bad to say about the food. The sushi options were very creative and the rolls my boyfriend and I ordered (Crunchy Spicy Tuna, Leo, Eel Special, Spicy Tuna) were delicious. However, the service was not as satisfying.

I watched as our sushi sat at the bar, waiting for pick up, for about ten minutes. Meanwhile, our server milled about the restaurant doing nothing in particular. When our food was finally delivered, she had requested that tobiko be put on the wrong roll. Not a problem, I just requested some extra on the side for the naked roll. Our server agreed to the request then disappeared. She didn't come near our table again until the meal was over, and then offered me the side of tobiko with a smug, "well I guess it's a little late".

I got her name off the receipt, and if I return, I will not be sitting in her section. The food at a restaurant can be incredible, but bad service can make or break a meal. I hope that this is something the management recognizes and works on.
This place was good,  not the best sushi I've ever had but I would come back. Cocktails were delicious. Reasonably priced.

I've come for their $11 all-you-can-eat lunch special several times now, and it hits the spot every time. Yes, the sushi rolls are small and simple, but it's still fresh and a great deal for that price. The restaurant itself is also nicely decorated with a clean, modern finish. Great place to satisfy sushi cravings!

Went to eat here with a friend on a week night.  We sat at the bar and it took forever for us to get our sushi.  It took so long that I finally had to ask the waitress about it, which I rarely do.  

The sushi we had was good but not earth shattering and the decor is very modern.  Due to the slow slow service I probably won't return.
Looooved this sushi restaurant. So many great and tasty options to choose from. The desserts are great. The service was fast. Best of all the prices were unbeatable.

I was very pleasantly surprised by the quality and freshness of the sushi. The lunch special rolls are indeed small with only 4 pieces, as the previous review noted, so you may have to order more to fill you up. The eel hand roll was delicious and not overly drenched with unagi sauce like so many restaurants like to do. They do a great job with the sushi rice, which combined with fresh ingredients and clean preparations left me very pleased with the meal. It is a good place to dine alone for a business dinner either at a table or at the small bar. Very reasonable for a casual dinner in a nice environment. Parking is easy.

Maybe it's because I come from O'ahu, but I was not too impressed by this sushi joint. Granted, it was a pretty good deal for $10 all-you-can-eat -sushi but the rice to fish ratio was really off (more rice than fish). The fish also wasnt as fresh as one would hope bit perhaps decent for the South.

We had such a great time we decided to try it again! I still am completely in love with the Metro roll but the presentation was a bit less put together this time - and the food seems to take quite awhile to come out. I will say I found a delicious new drink- the Cucumber Refresher - not too sweet or sour but just right. I will say their martini's/cocktails pack a punch so be careful or take a cab!

This five star review is based on happy hour (4-6) on Monday-Friday.

You can not beat the happy hour prices and drink specials.   I took a picture of the current happy hour menu.  The restaurant is also not crowded at this time so your service is impeccable and the food comes out promptly.

We ordered 2 screaming o's, 1 panther roll, 1 crunchy spicy tuna, and the pork gyoza appetizer.  My total bill was $34 before tip.  What a deal!  You can't get this quality and quantity of sushi anywhere else in charlotte for this price.  My husband says it's the best sushi in charlotte. 

My favorite is the screaming o.  So amazing. :)

Probably shouldn't have come here in yoga pants a sweaty mess from cycling. But when you need sushi you need it. We sat at the bar and the bartender was great! Upon the suggestion of other yelpers we started with the brussel sprouts. Do not not get these. They melt in your mouth. I am pretty sure all of the nutritional qualities of brussel spouts are voided but that's fine. Well worth it. 

It was hard to narrow down a couple of rolls because everything looked amazing. I love mango in sushi so we got a slammin salmon and we also got a k-pop because fried jalapeno. Both were amazing! Some of the best tasting sushi I have had, you just dont get a lot for the money since they don't do bogo. I am definitely interested in hitting up the all you can eat sushi for lunch one Friday.

The location and vibe of Pisces is great - right in the midst of the action at the Metropolitan, but across the street so you get a bit of separation. Plus, you walk in and the darkened room gives you a bit of a breather from whatever stress you have felt outside.

When it comes to food, the sushi is definitely on the upside, though in some cases looks like they have spent some more time on the appearance than anything else. It's not a bad thing, just a thing. When it comes to other items (hibachi, etc), the dishes are also good, but nothing earth-shattering. Again, it's like more time is spent on the appearance than anything else.

Now there isn't anything wrong with a lounge being a lounge, but a lounge being a restaurant? To borrow - and paraphrase - from Jerry Seinfeld, there isn't anything wrong with that, but it lends airs that just make it seem a bit indifferent. If you're there for cocktails then it might be a better experience. If you're there for dinner, it's a bit less impressive.

This place is ok. Nothing special. Came here for a very late lunch with a friend (3pm). We got sat at the worst table possible. Up against a wall and it was super small. They weren't busy at all. Maybe 2 tables including us. We waited a while to be greeted. When we were finally greeted and we told her our drink order and that took a very long time to get our drinks. 

We ordered the calamari and each a sushi roll. The calamari was good but very salty. I got the bastard roll and it was good but you can tell the avocado was not fresh. It was super mushy and slightly slimey. My friend liked her roll. 

Overall, this place is just ok. Nothing super impressive about it and a little overrated. Service could have definitely improved especially with hardly anyone in there.

This restaurant will get you sick. I had such severe food poisoning after eating here that put me in the hospital. The quality of fish used should have been a red flag in the first place but because it was a cheap lunch buffet, I ignored it. Will never visit this place again and I highly recommend finding somewhere else to go for a sushi buffet. There are too many options in Charlotte to subject yourself to low-quality fish.

To elaborate and provide guidance to those reading:

The hostess/servers are rude and slow. Expect to be ignored. 

I started with the gyoza which was pretty good. From there I chose to upgrade the buffet $5 with the Nigiri option - probably where everything went wrong. 

I ordered the tuna and salmon nigiri which both came out off-colored. Sushi grade fish is known for its vibrant colors, this looked like it had been sitting for a month. It tasted that way as well so I moved on to the rolls. 

When they brought out the rolls, I chuckled because it looks like a toddler was in the back smashing rice around the fish and then throwing it on the plate. It was 9/10 rice with a smidge of fish. (Ordered Philly, jalapeño, & shrimp tempura).So we ordered more because we were hungry after the first rolls. The second round came out just as bad (ordered crab salad & spicy tuna). Sushi can be better made at home. 

It was a late lunch so we didn't eat for the rest of the day. The symptoms began immediately on Sunday morning and by Tuesday, I was in the ER. 

Overall, terrible experience during and after.

I've eaten here so many times and I can say that the food is always spectacular!! They have never let me down. The part that is a crap-shoot is where you sit. If you get those amazing booths that have darkness and privacy, you're golden. But if you are at one of the tables and there are tons of other people out there, too, you can't even have a conversation without yelling at your friends. The acoustics in there are insane. It's the opposite of a nice, inviting place to have a meal.
The only time I've ever had a bad experience was when I went in for an early dinner, around 4:00, on a weekend and we asked our server if we could sit in one of the booths...and she straight up said no. There were people still in one booth (I assume left over from lunchtime) and I totally get that she was the bartender and she would have to walk an extra 20 feet to serve us (which she explained)...but, before we even got our food, we were the only customers in there, one table of four. Granted, I had a bad day earlier, so it upset me more than it usually would. But, even on a good day, I thought that was kind of messed up. When we first arrived, there was a table of what appeared to be coworkers having lunch together and they were so obnoxiously loud, we couldn't hear a single word any of us were saying. Hence, the request for a booth. Luckily they left right before we were served our food. 
Oh well. Just one bad experience out of a whole bunch. But, I'd rather warn someone else about it and save them slight unhappiness than let it go.

Came to this sushi bar for the "happy hour special" that ended at 230pm - not sure when it starts. The atmosphere is nice and would be a great date place with Drake playing in the background ;) The happy hour including different speciality rolls and such for only $11! The menu also had different items to chose from like hibachi. I had a Moscow mule called CARDI B which was pretty good ! I don't even eat sushi much but this was definitely a great place to try different rolls. Remember to read the fine print because if you waste your food you will be charged full price !

I am not a fish/sushi eater, but the Karyu roll at Pisces is the only roll I will eat. If you like spicy foods, but are like me and don't eat a lot of fish, this is a great roll to start with! Pisces also has a great drink list/specials and awesome lunch specials. The only reason I am giving it 4 stars is because I think the dinner menu is a little overpriced.

This is a nice little location. The atmosphere is great and very laid back. Only thing to worry about is the parking - always a pain with Metropolitan - but don't let that stop you! We had a lunch meeting and enjoyed their All You Can Eat Sushi. The place wasn't loud so there were no issues with having a serious work conversation. 

I encourage everyone to come!

This is one of my favorite sushi places in Charlotte. The atmosphere is intimate and cozy, especially if you get one of the hidden away booths. 

The sushi list is extensive and full of creative rolls and creative cocktails. 

The Rainbow Roll is one of the best ones I've ever had. The Jumanji Roll and Screaming O are wonderful as well. 

The service has always been excellent as well.

Another sushi bar in Charlotte, ok, sure, I'll bite! 

Never one to turn down any sushi experience, hubs and I rolled into Pisces to grab a quick, light dinner. The interior is modern, but more casual (and a bit smaller) than I anticipated. Regardless, we were seated right away and greeted within minutes. Our server was quite friendly and offered a few roll suggestions when asked. The sushi menu is pretty extensive, but at least half of the rolls have either cream cheese or some fried element in them. Not my favorite types - I prefer fresh fish and spices to cream cheese and fried goodness. At least in my sushi. 

Soy paper is available for $1, which is a nice addition for those who aren't seaweed fans. Hubs and I tried just two rolls, the First Love - crab, avocado, shrimp, mango, and the Rainbow Roll - California roll with assorted fresh fish on top. Both rolls were well-made and the fish was supremely fresh. Overall, the rolls are priced fairly all around. 

I read about the $9 All You Can Eat sushi lunch buffet and I'd definitely like to check that out when my tummy's a-rumblin'.
The crystal veg is a great roll! Can be pretty loud but very good sushi. love the little cave like booths in the back. Great for 4 people.
Was very unhappy with the sushi. Either I'm spoiled because I'm used to sushi form CA or this place just does not do amazing sushi. I had to return my food right away, and left.

Like a fine wine... this place just keeps getting better with age.

Now three plus years old, Pisces has expanded into the space next door to create a trendy bar and lounge area.

Cocktail genius Bob Peters continues to pull more tricks out of his bag. If you go to this place and order a Bud Light- you're doing it wrong. This is what real bartending is all about. Whether he's using a carbonator, playing with new liquor infusions or adding smoke to a cocktail... put your drink decisions in this man's hands. Intimidated? Tell him what you like. He'll come up with the perfect concoction for you.

Hungry? The best bang for your buck happens at lunch with the all you can eat sushi deal for $14.

My biggest problem at Pisces is narrowing down my order. I have to issue self-imposed restrictions or I will easily convince myself that I need five rolls. They're all delish but here are my current three favs (yes they change every few months):

Leo (tuna, mango, avocado and chili oil). I love the chili oil kick of this one.

Kissy (mango, crab, cream cheese in soy paper, re-wrapped with basil and rice paper) There is just something so clean and delicious about this roll.

XoXo (crab, avocado, topped with baked scallop and a honey mayo eel sauce) The topping just takes this roll to a new level.

I'm also a big of the Tuna Bruschetta for starters and Tempura Oreo with green tea ice cream for the grand finale. 

For the late night crowd, Pisces also serves food til 2AM on weekends.

Need some entertainment for your food coma? Stare at the jellyfish tank. It'll hypnotize you for hours.
Their happy hour sushi special rocks! On Wednesday's it's half priced sushi and bottle of wine from 4-6. The sushi is always fresh!

We were highly disappointed with the experience after seeing so many good reviews. We called in a to go order and the staff taking the order did not even know the sauces on the menu I was asking about.  I also requested sauce to be on the side but it was globbed on the top.  My girlfriends cucumber rolls were the smallest pieces of sushi I had ever seen, and the same goes for my $3 sashimi yellowfin tuna.  After spending $23 on two rolls we were extremely unsatisfied and ended up grabbing breakfast sandwiches at McDonalds.  I would recommend trying anywhere else. I have had 5x better sushi at cowfish and ginbu for half the price.

I wanted sushi for my birthday and had been having difficulty finding a good place since returning to NC from California. This place was wonderful. Our server was fabulous and the meal was just wonderful. We would highly recommend it to others with the caveat that it is a little pricey.
Amazing and fresh what's not to like. Service was on point never had a empty glass. I tried 11 different fish all of which where high quality will be back for sure

Showed up around 2:45 on Friday for late lunch alone.   Was greeted by a nice host.  He let me choose my table.   

I was greeted by my server who took my drink order and who was also polite.  She asked if I needed a few minutes to look over the menu.  I did.

10 minutes passed....and she never came back.   I observed....she had lots of tables to serve, pre-bus, and check - out.   She wandered around with very little urgency.  

I got tired of waiting.... so I just walked out.  No one seemed to notice I was even there or that I was leaving.   I kind of felt invisible.

Im sure the sushi was gonna be fabulous....but unfortunately, my fist visit to this restaurant....we didn't even get to the food.

I gave it 2 stars for the over all experience of being overlooked.....it's not that there was a bad experience.  It was just disappointing because I could have gone to my regular sushi joint....but wanted to try something different.

Bummer.

Went here a couple of weeks ago and it was pretty good. I tried the dynamite roll and a basic spicy shrimp roll. I am not a huge sushi eater but I can't complain! The only thing that really annoyed me was the container holding soy sauce was prettier than it was practical; you could not pour soy sauce out without spilling it all over the table! And it wasn't just me - every person at our table had the same problem! Then, on top of that, either my little "bowl" for soy sauce was dirty, or something weird came out of the soy sauce itself, but it was not fit for eating and I had to use the big saucer instead - haha, I am sure I looked ridiculous, but whatever! When the waitress noticed, she was very nice about it and told me I should have told her so she could get me another small "bowl." She's right, but I didn't make a big deal about it (because honestly it's not a big deal) and I was ok using my big saucer. Anyway, overall it was ok and I'm sure I'll go back.

All you can eat is the best deal in Charlotte, happy hour is bangin, and it is a great spot for a date. I've been eating here for five years and have never had a bad server. The fish is always fresh, and if you want to try something different, they have a list of specials that rotate every week. Oh, and not to mention some amazing drink specials. Definitely one of my favorites in the Charlotte area.

It's not often that a martini alone drives me to write a review, but let me tell you, the Far East Manhattan I DEVOURED last night (beverages can totally be devoured), was phenomenal.  Take your traditional Manhattan (whiskey or bourbon, bitters, sweet vermouth and don't forget that cherry) and put it on a flight to Hong Kong and this is what you'll get: A delicious concoction of rye bourbon, ginger liqueur, sparking sake and bitters. Sweet, smooth, spicy.  I am a sucker for anything ginger, so I had high hopes for this cocktail and it did not disappoint.

 I am not going to try to guess the alcohol content of this beverage, but let's just say that I was in no position to order a second. Next time I will bet trying the Shiso martini: orange vodka, ginger liqueur (yeah!), barley liqueur and fresh shiso. I'm counting down the minutes...

The food was good too! You can't go wrong with their seaweed salad and simple but fresh sushi menu.  I respect the lack of bells and whistles. Definitely ask for one of the intimate booths in the back if you're feeling romantic like that.

On 12/13 I experienced one of the worst customer service of my life at Pisces sushi and bar. 

Arrived at 1126 for a business meeting and was told they open at 1130. Its 40 degrees outside and the parking is difficult. Asked if I could wait Inside for 4 minutes - was rudely told NO please wait outside. 
Asked to speak to the manager (a tatted up hipster arrived) and said, " I heard your conversation - wait outside!" 

I said, "No Thanks" . Needless to say, I'll not be returning to Pisces again. 

Especially with other great Sushi locations in CHARLOTTE such as Yama and Nikko.

I was only in town for the night and I'm really glad I ended up here (thanks to the desk clear at the Westin).  The food was great, the service stunning and knowledgeable and the atmosphere chill and laid back.  If I find myself back in  Charlotte again I hope I get to go back.
Dana made our first experience here amazing. We asked her to surprise us with an appetizer and she brought the brussel sprouts. DELICIOUS! Can't wait to come back.
Tried for Queen's Feast. Decent enough and waitstaff was good. Even got wine with our price-fixed menu which I thought was nice. In accessible location with plenty of parking.

I was invited back to the restaurant by the owner to give it another try. 

Alexandria our server was awesome. She gets 5 stars just for being so lovely.

I tried the A2, Frying Tuna, and Screaming O... They were good, all offering something a little different.

The BEST was the Tempura Oreos. Sounds bonkers, right? No! Eat them.. Be willing to get too full off of them... They are heaven.

By far my favorite place to get sushi. I'm there at least once a week for the lunch all you can eat sushi and kitchen items. They make the sushi fresh so you know it's not been sitting out. The fried rice and spring rolls are phenomenal, and all the sushi is well-made. The restaurant is contemporary and good looking, and the staff friendly.

FIRST TIME EATING HERE... Staff was great. 
Good was really good... I'm not a big fan of Sushi, but I would send my friends who are here.
Omakase all the way! Tell them your preferences and prepare for greatness the likes of San Francisco.

I've been here a few times, and always had a great experience. Customer Service is always good, there is never a wait when I go but then again I never went on a Friday or Saturday night. The I've only eaten tried their sushi but it's tasty, and reasonably priced. A great place to grab a bite!

The word pisces comes from a Latin word meaning fishes. And it's also one of the zodiac signs - shaped like a fish. 

Pisces Sushi Bar & Lounge has lots of jelly fishes in a tank. The interesting thing is that these jelly fishes shrink as they age and by the time they die, they're almost unrecognizable with naked eyes. Fortunately, these wonderful folks at Pisces will get new jellies once they all die out, which takes only a few months. I had no idea they only live for a few months.

Anyway, let's talk about their food and service. The people who work there are really nice and friendly. I asked a bunch of questions about their food, and stared at their jelly fish for some time, and they were totally fine with it. In fact, they came up to me and just sharing all these wonderful information about the amazing creatures that we call jelly fish!

Seriously though, there's a lot more going on there than just the jelly fish tank. Their miso soup is really good. I mean authentic northeast Asian, made-for-cold-winters, proper doenjang, miso. I went there not knowing they had extended their restaurant week menu so I got to try their gyoza and loco moco for $30. And they were both on point. Gyozas are supposed to be thin, a bit chewy, with marinaded meat inside. Those warm apps all passed the test. Loco moco was alright too. Their large, moist, and chewy rice hit home hard. Be careful though. It's really hot.

Oh, the place looks really small from outside but they have more tables hidden inside on both sides of the restaurant so be bold and open that door for your East Asian culinary experience.
Traveled the whole way from Pittsburgh and this is some of the best sushi.  Do yourself a favor and don't second guess coming here to try it!

Similar to other reviews, let's be honest, I went here for the $10 sushi buffet during weekday lunch. Between my friend and I, we tried several different rolls. They're all basic and you get four pieces of each, so not a full roll like you'd get at other places. My favorite was the eel and avocado, seemed to have the most substance. The crispy roll is a skip, it literally was like tempura flakes rolled in seaweed and rice. Didn't taste extremely fresh, but for $10, how high can your standards really be? 

Rolls weren't anything spectacular, fried rice (also included in the all-you-can-eat) was not your typical fried rice, it was sticky rice that looked like they tossed some carrots in. I wouldn't order it again. The spring rolls were just okay, sauce was at least yummy. Service seemed slow for a weekday lunch, after I arrived it took forever for our waiter to come back and take our order, but he was semi-attentive after that until the place started to fill up. He at least didn't let our drinks go empty. If I return, I'd probably order a roll off the actual menu next time.
Not overly impressed.  Just overpriced sushi.  I wish it wasn't as expensive so I could try different things and come more often. Service was decent, nothing wonderful.

The few recent negative reviewers must have been on meth ... this place rocks and does NOT dissappoint.  I would eat at Pisces over Rusan's any day of the week.  At lunch, Rusan's has their sushi sit out buffet-style, which to me is unacceptable for seafood.  At Pisces, it's made to order and extremely fresh.  

By the way Julian E., if you are a hungry guy, go there during lunch.  It's all you can eat for just under $12.

Everything here is fantastic. They've recently added new sushi rolls to the menu and I have to say I'm never afraid to try anything new here because I know it will be delicious. Screaming 'O' is a must try. The infused vodkas are fun to try too. They don't have drink specials anymore and I wish they'd bring those back, but the food makes up for that!

All I can say is.... AMAZING! I really enjoyed this place. My server, Lin, was so friendly and attentive. I really like the atmosphere also. My friend and I wanted to try a few things so we ordered the miso soup, crab dumplings, calamari, and spring rolls as starters. For our entrees we both had sushi rolls. I had the little bastard roll and my friend had the aries roll. All of the food was amazing. 

We also ordered the little mini crabs that they sell. They're flash fried and you pop them like potato chips. You eat them whole, shell and all. It was an experience lol. If you're into trying different things you may like them. 

This place also offers unlimited sushi lunch specials during the week so I know I'll be back for that. I definitely recommend this place if you're in the area.

It's time to update my rating though it remains 4 stars. The Knights roll, calamari, and Tokyo Cowboy are my standard meal. The Tokyo Cowboy has jalepeno syrup, which I think is really a unique flavor. So unique, I'm going to make some with this old jalepeno I have laying around. Service still is consistently great and so is the food quality. Thursdays are 1/2 priced cocktails, though every night has a drink special worth coming out for. There is also an all you can eat lunch that's good on Saturdays, so add it to your brunch list.

You cannot beat this place for all you can eat sushi lunch. It really might be the best deal in Charlotte. And you only get half portions of each roll so you can sample a lot of different ones. Their spicy tuna roll is always on point, as well as their tuna and avocado. Their spicy crab salad roll only is crab salad with a line of Siracha, which might be my only complaint, but the crab salad is flavorful. Also, their garlic noodles and spring rolls are delicious, so save room for them, or at least a spring roll.

Good sushi but my fiancé and I have had much better.  Maybe because we have been to the best of the best, but this was just ok and nothing spectacular.  It was fresh ingredients though and a nice cute date spot for maybe a first date.  Service was quick!

I've never been to picses and not been impressed. Their staff is friendly, the location is clean, the food is good and the ambiance is great. I've even had a working dinner there and their staff was super accomodating with my request to be near an outlet, and left me alone but checked in to ensure I had everything I needed. They also have great drink specials.

This is a good venue for a group gathering, too.

Amazing food. Had the dynamite roll and some crab rolls it was the best I have had in a long time. Service was the best part got to hang with Henry who knew his stuff. If I am in the area again I will be sure to visit this place.
The sushi is good but you only get 5-6 rolls. The hibachi isn't flavored but the mayo sauce is good. The music is great. Friendly servers.

First of all, when I ask for a gluten free menu he says we don't have one, but can you eat soy...like soy has anything to do with gluten.  So I have to read the whole menu to make sure nothing had temporarily in it.  It took me awhile and what I ordered want even good, was bland.  My friend got the octopus which didn't even taste fresh to me.

We also didn't have s reservation and when we got there at 7 there wasn't even anyone in the place yet we had to sit at the bar with the bearded bar tenders.  I'm sad that one of my favorite places to eat had declined so much in customer service and price, (did I mention the drinks are 18dollars) yikes.  so let's just say I won't be coming back here anytime soon

Went last Saturday and it was great. Had the Love Boat which was a lot of sushi.  Spicy tuna rolls, amazing! The booths are quiet and private, a perfect place for a date so you can have good conversation. The only reason I did not give it five stars is the prices of the drinks.  Although GREAT, the drinks are a bit pricey. I had the divine wind martini which is really good.

I have been coming to Pisces for about 3 years now.  EVERYTHING about this place is amazing!  The staff always provides a fine-dining experience and have great personalities.  The food is by far the freshest seafood/sushi/steak I've had in Charlotte and is consistently above expectation.  My boyfriend (who previously didn't like sushi) won't eat it anywhere else and wants to go ALL the time... I pretty much don't enjoy sushi at any other place after eating here.  It's a beautiful place and the management and owners are always pleasant and contribute to the overall experience.  If you haven't been here yet, you must go NOW!!  With all-you-can-eat sushi during the week at lunch... how can you not?

I had dinner there with a friend. Love the decor and the service was realy good. The fillet appetizer was absolutly amazing definitly want that again! We both got the hibachi chicken it was considerably over done and dry but I could tell that the flavors would have been spot on if it wan't so over cooked. The sake was served hot the way it's supposed to be. Overall I will be back!

Please read if you're planning on going. It ends with food poisoning. 

Me and my boyfriend have been reading fantastic reviews about this place, so we finally decided to try it for lunch today. Upon first walking in, the two girls waiting to seat people, (yes, two people, ten minutes after they opened, on a Sunday, to SEAT people) had sour looks on their faces, and acted like it was an inconvenience to even seat us. With only three couples in the obnoxiously trying to be fancy 'dining' part of the weird bar/sushi theme they have going, obviously trying to make believe they were in Manhattan, they sat us at a table a foot away from another couple, instead of the other 10 empty seats not directly next to someone. It seemed weird, the girls were rude, but we let it slide. The waitress came over, had the same sour look on her face, and took our order. We ordered off the all you can eat sushi menu, since that was the only menu we were given. We ordered one of every appetizer (there were 5), and I got the sweet potato roll and two avocado rolls. My boyfriend got a california roll and a shrimp tempura roll. The 'appetizers' we got were probably the best part. One was noodles in soy sauce. One was a ball of rice. One was a spring roll that tasted like it came straight out of a cheap Chinese take out place, one was pork gyoza (i didn't eat this, but my boyfriend said it was so so), and last but not least, 'fried wontons' which was really just those little strip Chinese take outs gives you on the side of your soup, with a side of Chinese take out sauce to dip in. Whatever, we ignored it, it's only $11 for the all you can eat each and the garlic noodles weren't bad. Then the horrid thing they call sushi came out. They looked like they had been cut in half and smashed. The sweet potato roll was literally just baked sweet potato chunks wrapped in rice. I don't know if any of you have ever had sweet potato rolls, but the sweet potato part is always tempura, and it is always drizzled in a dark brown sauce. Whether you are in Pennsylvania, NYC, Charlotte, or California, that is how a roll is. That was terrible as is. Then the avocado rolls, which was 1/7th avocado, 6/7th rice. 

Then to my boyfriends. The Shrimp was cold in the middle, fried on the outside, and the crap tasted like fake canned crab. 

We finished what was in front of us and immediately asked for the check. Our stomachs were still growling because it all was such small portions, and we hadn't eaten yet for the day, but there was not a chance in hell we were eating another bite of this nonsense. 

We didn't eat again, because even though we were hungry, we felt sick to our stomachs over just that small amount. The food was coming up for the rest of the day, and we both weren't able to eat again. My boyfriend, having eaten the shrimp and crab, got food poisoning. 

I would sooner eat 7/11 sushi over this place ever again. This place is not even worth the $11. If you want ACTUALLY good sushi, go to harris teeter, get the sushi from there (which is whole heartedly 15x better) and sit in the dining area. You'll have a much more pleasant experience.

Took a while for a server to talk to us but they made up for it with edamame on the house. Calamari was not my favorite (I prefer it to be more tentacle like) but the dragon roll and shellfish bastard roll were AMAZING! The Eagle down south was also an excellent take on an old fashioned (a little sweeter which I enjoyed).
Absolutely incredible. The ambiance, food, cocktails, and hospitality are all exceptional. I've been in Charlotte for two years and haven't found anything that tops this place!

**Gem Alert**  I am loving Charlotte!  Basically because of places like this located in sweet ol' Midtown.  I went here with a Groupon coupon just expecting to get a good deal for my money.  I left with some much more.  This is exactly what I want for every one of my future restaurant experiences.  Walking in, the entire set up is uniquely designed to subtly stand out.  The booths are romantically secluded out of sight and everything else just screams modern.  From the chairs to the dishes, this place has its own style.  

We ordered our drinks from the cocktail menu and I had to start with the cucumber refresher (see pic).  Wow!  Half way through it I had to go up to the bar to have a word with the bartender.  Brian.. is the man!  He took care of us the rest of the meal.  He to our table and asked us what we liked, listened,  and customized our drinks perfectly to sublime satisfaction.  That is superior service.  Thanks Brian!  Our waitress was very knowledgeable about all of the sushi and we went to TOWN.  We got everything... trust me, you cant go wrong.  

Then we somehow found room for some dessert.  I struck gold with the fried cheesecake (see pic) and the Wife got the lava cake (see pic).  I wanted to give this place 4 stars because things were a bit pricey but then we had dessert.  I felt so satisfied with spending big money here and would gladly be depositing more very soon.  If you have to, go out of your way and stop by this spot for a great meal.  Best sushi for me was the Metro roll.  Oh yeah!   Enjoy!

-Ian M.

Went here for all you can eat sushi when Dressler's was closed. You're supposed to eat all your rolls, which I understand. Beware, don't order rice because they make you eat a big bowl of fried rice that has maybe one pea in it, with no eggs or pay full price. I have a few problems with this: 1. The fried rice was horrible. 2. I would never pay for a bowl of fried rice that bad! 3. I would rather get a 13 dollar roll of the regular menu and eat it all than eat any of their rolls on the all you can eat menu. Unless their regular menu is just as bad. 4. Their all you can eat rolls are sorry. Really pathetic for a sushi role. I've been to many all you can eat sushi places that were way way better. If you can't afford to make a decent all you can eat, then don't have an all you can eat!!!!! It was honestly an all you can eat crappy fried rice bowl rather than an all you can eat sushi. Cocktails were good, hence the one star.

I reserved a table for restaurant week and was late. They held it for 40 minutes after I called so that was appreciated, but we lost our table and was fortunate to find a seat at the bar. We met Bob and he was awesome. Live music from guy playing cover songs on guitar, which was great especially when he played classics. Hibachi is hard to find in Charlotte and I can see why. The food wasnt the special yummy Hibachi I am used to up North but I wouldn't  mind going back for drinks and live music.
Too trendy for me. Good food. Not great. Pricey and full of quality but I couldn't get on board with this place for some reason. I can't figure out why.

Whether it's an after work quick bite, a romantic evening, or even a business party Pisces hits the spot. I wasn't always a fan of sushi but I've been expanding recently and decided to give this place a try. It's hard to find good sushi deals where the sushi is actually legitimate. After doing some hardcore Yelp research Pisces was the place. 

Located in the Metropolitan area surrounded by other great restaurants and places to shop you are sure to find something to spend your evening doing... other then enjoying great sushi! 

Happy hour has the best prices so don't miss out on that! It really allows you to try a lot of different rolls. Each one is superbly crafted and not just thrown together half heartedly. I'll definitely be going back when I'm in the sushi mood.

Looking for apathetic attitudes, crowds(kinda more like a wait without a crowd), and subpar sushi? This is your place. After hearing rave reviews from colleagues and friends I decided to give Pisces a try for a quick lunch. 

Walked in around 12:00 and was told there was a wait for at table despite half to the place being empty. Happily sat at the bar to avoid the seemingly unexplainable wait. Ordered the AYCE sushi because why not? Well I will tell you why not...the rolls are poorly constructed. I get serving in half orders to cut down on waste, but the rolls are really small and the rice to filling ratio is very clearly off to cut costs. Was kind of confused by their menu as there were a lot of options with Mango asked the waitress about it and she just shrugged and gave some sarcastic quip. I was genuinely interested about the mango and if the place was going for a fusion vibe, but clearly the bartender didn't seem interested in answering questions. 

The service only went down hill from there, the bartender was surprisingly never behind the bar, thus making refills and a reorder basically impossible. Literally had to flag her down from across the restaurant. To make matters worse I could hear a male staff member making remarks about the appearance of a patron to another staff member, not the place or time.

Go on Thursday!!! Monday through Friday they have half price sushi from 4-6pm! However, if you go on Thursday they also have half price cocktails all night! Taking advantage of both is the way to go! It was so nice to order multiple rolls and drinks and not be worried about the price! 

I liked my tequila and bourbon cocktails the best! The dessert cocktail with chocolate was also very good. We ordered multiple rolls, with the Screaming O being the best! We also had one with scallops on it that was excellent. The servers were very nice, and it was nice to sit at the bar and chat with them. 

I hear they have a lunch buffet as well, but I have yet to go. 

I will come back, but I will likely only come during the discounted hours.

Been to Pisces several times for sushi or drinks @ Metropolitan. The food and sushi is almost always good there so you can't go wrong. I also love the hidden booths on the side of the restaurant (great little spot for a romantic date) but I rarely get one. Pisces is a decent place to go for sushi in a town with a lot of sushi options. The reason I am writing this review now is that I went to Pisces last night for a drink and found 1/2 priced glasses of wine on Mondays (and a packed restaurant) --which was a nice start prior to our dinner @ Dressler's next door. The bartender told us about the various drink specials throughout the week as well as M-F 4-6PM 1/2 priced food for happy hours. More good food & drink for less cost.

Pisces is a place that I would probably only go to for lunch to take advantage of their All You Can Eat sushi.  It is a nice atmosphere inside, and the perk is it is right across the street from where I work.  

I do have to say, their Garlic Noodles are so BOMB!!!  The past few times I have gone there, I must confess that I order not one, but TWO plates of the Garlic Noodles.  I feel that sometimes the service is slacking a bit.  The times that I have gone there, it did not seem that busy, but it would take someone a long time for them to bring back a water, or just giving me the bill.

Yum, yum, yum! I was skeptical cause I'm not big on Japanese cuisine but I'm so glad I gave it a try. I had a sampling of all the apps and they were all great. My favorite was the spring rolls. So crunchy! All the sauces were flavorful and perfect accompaniments as well. For the entree I got the hibachi Chicken and Shrimp. More food than I could eat in two days! I have to go back to try the Thai Salad.

This place rocks! I have ate here twice in the past couple weeks and received great service both times. The food came fast, was delicious and very reasonably priced. And the sushi at lunch time is all you can eat, how much better does it get?! I highly recommend this spot if you are in the Uptown Charlotte area and need a new sushi spot or if you are just passing through!

Came here for Dine Out Charlotte restaurant week. Our server was very friendly and attentive, although it took awhile for her to initally serve us. Food was delicious, both the hibachi and the sushi were as good as anywhere else in Charlotte if not better. Only small annoyance was that half of our table was brought food and the rest didn't get theirs for another 10 minutes. Kitchen staff should work on getting food ready together. Otherwise a great experience.

I come here quite often and every time has been a great experience.  I usually take myself to the bar and the bartender is always on it making the best cocktails.  The sushi is amazing and you always have a manager coming by and shaking your hand and asking how everything is going.  The few times I have sat at a table the waitstaff is very prompt and helpful; making good recommendations with a good attitude every time.

If you haven't tried this place out....you must!

The food is always amazing and the staff are very friendly.  You have a wide variety of seating options from traditional tables to booths that are extremely private in the back of the room.  Sushi is always prepared fresh and quick to suit your busy schedule.  There are nights every week where they have half off bottles of wine, call ahead to verify the correct date. This is somewhat new to the business.  The dining area is clean and so are the restrooms.  Great for parties and large groups.

The is probably one of the best sushi restaurants that I have been to. The food was really wonderful and the atmosphere is nice. I love the music that they play and our waitress was really nice, friendly and knowledgeable. I would recommend this restaurant if you are looking to have some delicious sushi. They have multiple options of food and give you large portions.
Very good food and great service!! The all you can eat was more than just sushi!!  Well worth the try

Cool Modern feel. Awesome Sushi. Live music was fantastic. Being foodies, my fiance and I have made the rounds in Charlotte since moving here from Austin this year. This is not only our favorite sushi spot, but one of our favorite restaurants. Definitely worth checking out. We'll be back soon!

Honestly, I feel like half the rolls on the menu have the same ingredients, but I like most of those ingredients so I'm okay with it.

My first lunch at Pisces was a on saturday (no ayce deal) and even though we didn't see any booths we accepted the hostess' offer to sit in one. She took us into the almost empty restaurant and down a hallway to the right, and voila! booths with cute fishbowl shaped privacy cut outs. (or fine, just circles, but we liked the idea of fishbowls) we ordered four different rolls, and they were all decent, though we each clearly had a least favorite (my brain and taste buds had a hard time deciding if tomatoes should be on sushi). The service was attentive, and we enjoyed our meal even though we could hear every word of the conversation a few booths overs. 

My second lunch fell on a weekday, and the ayce special. (You order off an abridged menu, it's not a buffet) I was a little hesitant since they go out of their way to say they'll charge you for waste (especially leftover rice on your plate) and really, it seems a little unnecessary. But, we did learn that the orders are half rolls, so if you choose a spicy tuna and a cucumber roll, you'll get four pieces of each instead of a full eight pieces of each. We ended up just ordering off the regular menu but plenty of people around us were loving the special.

Even though I've tried a roll in every price range (they're nicely listed in increasing prices on the menu), nothing really sets Pisces apart. Yes, the spicy tuna roll is good, but it doesn't stand out against another spicy tuna in town. They do have some nice flavor combos (though I haven't really delved into the ones with cream cheese, not my favorite sushi ingredient), eating at Pisces again would be more out of convenience since it's minutes from my house than going for a specific roll.  Overall good service, and not a long wait even when it was packed during the week.

Dinner started out great. The decor was very nice as well, especially liked the rock wall. Our waitress was witty, prompt and above all, honest. When i asked about the calamari, she plainly stated it sucked. I appreciate that heads up. The drinks came out quick and I really appreciated that. 

Those were the last drinks we would have for 20 minutes. We sat, admiring the walls, waiting and waiting and waiting. Our waitress would appear nearby but never approach our table.

20 minutes went by and an appetizer arrived. 10 minutes after that our sushi. It was mediocre, nothing special. Anyone that raves about this place having the best sushi has obviously not been exposed to many sushi restaurants. This sushi was uninspired and bland. 

I will not return, esp. with truly delicious sushi available for the same price at Jade in Ballantyne!

Came here for the $10 all you can eat sushi with a work friend. The ambiance is very classy and business casual. 

The fried rice is amazing. It's very light and filling- not greasy or heavily slathered in soy sauce. The sushi on the other hand was downright terrible. It mainly consists of rice versus meat. It also wasn't fresh. It tasted like those grab and go sushi trays from bookstores and gas stations (trust me, been there tried that). 

I'm always down for sushi at a reasonable price but if you are more adventurous than eating California rolls and shrimp tempura go elsewhere and spend the extra $.

Pretty good sushi and love the $10 lunch all you can eat! Cant beat that deal! I would recommend and will return. The spring rolls are pretty good and the service was okay. Thats the main reason it got 4 stars.

One of my favorite spots in Charlotte for sushi! Their sushi lunch buffet is delicious and garlic noodles are a must. Try out their mixed drinks as they always have something new and fresh! The sushi is very fresh and the atmosphere is unique in Charlotte. Their new lounge and jellyfish tank are must-see while enjoying Pisces' food.
Pisces has always been great. That's to our wonderful server, April it was a fantastic birthday lunch

Went for lunch with my girlfriend. We opt for the all you can eat sushi. Wasn't a bad deal.. we definitely ate our share of sushi. However my girlfriend is gluten intolerant as well as dairy intolerant. Ashley was our server she was more than helpful. Solid menu knowledge. The MOD with curly hair glasses and sleeve of awesome tattoos was also very knowledgeable as well. With their willingness to accommodate allergy needs we had a great experience!! I definitely recommend this place for a great friendly experience. 
Thanks guys!

How many sushi places does Charlotte have vs. need?!  But why not, my motto is never say no to sushi.  This place has a chic environment, nice location (close enough to Uptown but don't have to worry about parking; good for pre-party dining), and opens late (which is always good for that late night sushi crave).  Been here a few times, and honestly it's nothing too special.  My recap of tonight's experience:

Service was average, got seated right away (considering there's not waiting area to speak of, I don't think they have much choice but to get our butts to a table).  I had to look for my waiter to get my glass refilled at least once.  It took awhile to get our food, but we were busy talking so it wasn't a problem.  My friend ordered a last drink and asked for the check, and guess what, he got the check and not the drink. 

Food was ok.  But for the price, I have to say the portion is tiny.  One order will not feed a grown person (comparing to Enzo, for instance, where one order is enough to feel somewhat full).  The Dragon Roll came apart a little when I picked it up with my chopsticks.  The rice in both runchy rolls (we had Philly & Spicy Salmon) seem a little mushy.  We capped off our dinner with an order of red bean ice cream (which if you haven't tried, it's the best freaking ice cream flavor... and don't worry, you can get this at any sushi/japanese place, not just here... and they all taste similar).  I have never seen a worse scoop shape of ice cream in my entire dining life.  Bascially it's just one bowl of ice cream mess, but at least it tastes good.

So I guess I won't be running here, but maybe with a twist of an arm, I will stroll over.

This is our new favorite Sushi spot when we can get into the private booth section. What is exceptional about this place is the bar, service, and foods presentation.  I have never been to the All You Can Eat Buffet, only dinner. I found the Sushi and Sashimi here to be very fresh and very attractively presented so I was shocked to hear other bad reviews. We ordered Sushi Deluxe and Sashimi Deluxe plates.  I also had Uni which was fresh here. Hibachi Chicken was very well flavored with tender pieces of chicken served with fried rice and saute' broccoli and mushroom; Filet Mignon Stacker was cooked perfectly and a tempura roll was also generous portion. For dessert, we had green tea ice cream and Mango mochi both very similar tasting to other Sushi restaurants. I agreed that this place is very pricey.  Dinner for the four of us including 2 drinks were $198.  Our Sushi dinner at Musashi, our other favorite Sushi restaurant, is usually half this price but Musashi does not have a full bar and service is more traditional Japanese and so can be less attentive.
Great fresh sushi, best spicy garlic edamame I've ever had, must get! Really good service!

After reading the discussions in Talk and seeing some recommendations for Pisces, I thought we would give it a try. Even though it was early lunch time when we arrived, there was a good vibe coming off the place. The large bar area and the private booths in the back looked very comfy, but we took seats in the middle of the dining room.

Opting for the all-you-can-eat, the sushi is prepared when it is ordered as opposed to the buffet-style at other places. A handful of hot plates (noodles and such) are complimented by a few different nigiri-sushi, (salmon, tamago, mackerel, etc) and a dozen or so temaki rolls. Don't expect anything earth shattering, but the stuff that they do offer is good, quality sushi that isn't nearly all rice.

Our waitress was quite attentive, refilling sodas before they were empty and getting our sushi orders before the plate was gone.

Is it the best in Charlotte? Maybe not. Is it the best ayce in Charlotte? Possibly.

Found this place on my break from work. Walked in and it was small but comfortable. Everyday they have specials from all you can eat sushi to 1/2 off wine and cocktails. I got the "screaming-o" and it was delicious also got the garlic noodles. Over all had a great experience and I will definitely be coming back.

I am a regular at Pisces for their $10 all you can eat lunch special. Everything is made-to-order and usually really fresh. I always add the salad for an extra $2 because they serve high quality greens in their salad and I think they have awesome ginger dressing.

The only reason I rate Pisces 4 Stars is because of the service. It's usually pretty slow when I'm in there for lunch. Now, I understand it's busy. BUT sometimes it is hard to get in an out in an hour during my lunch break. I think Pisces could attract more business lunch-goers if they were a little quicker. Regardless, I'll be back!

I tried their taro slides and they are good.  The market price is also reasonably.  I like the fact that they are convinently located next to Trader Joes' and also within the metro shopping area.  I like their bar service, their music.  I would prefer that their waiters talk less to the bar customers and attend more to other dinning customers.  But otherwise, it is a good place to go for sushi, noodles, hand rolls in the afternoon.  I forgot to mention that the waiter who serviced me was nice enough to let me take a freshly brewed green tea in a cup to go.  That was a nice gesture!  
If you are with a large group of people, I would ask them to set aside an area for you.  But if you are a couple who plans to order a few dishes for sharing, ask them for a booth in the back for privacy.  The booths are cute and adds more value to create that Japanese feel of a tatami. :)

Happy hour review only. Holy cow, I have been missing out. I came here for the 1st time last week since and I wish I had taken advantage of Pisces sooner. They have amazing specials and an all you can eat sushi deal from Mon- Sat!

I walked over after work last week and stumbled upon the half priced sushi and cocktails deal, score! I ordered a couple of grey goose cocktails and a ninety-five roll for $6 each! The ninety five roll was actually really good despite the weirdish chicken included in the roll, maybe its just me but I've never seen a sushi roll with chicken. The roll was also huge, I struggled to finish it. My boyfriend ordered a half order of garlic noodles for $3, also huge, we had to share.

I will definitely be coming back for HH and the all you can eat sushi lunch deal! Cheers.

Disclaimer: I go here a lot.  This was the place I "learned to like sushi", so I am probably biased.  I have been here for regular dinner, the lunch buffet, and restaurant week dinner.  I always have a service experience ranging from "good" to "spectacular", leaning towards the spectacular end of the spectrum.  The decor is also great, especially if you can talk them into seating you in one of the cave-like booths during lunch.  It's like eating at home, but with someone to wait on you!

As far as the food goes.... I have never, ever, not been "wowed" at Pisces.  The lunch deal features a very limited menu, but all of the rolls and ngiri offered are fresh and flavorful, and the garlic noodles are absolutely off the charts.  I've never been to RuSans for dinner, but their lunch buffet is soggy and flavorless compared to the made to order goodness that is Pisces.  As far as dinner-I always use restaurant week to sample 2-3 restaurants in charlotte that I wouldnt normally go to and Pisces provided one of the best restaurant week experiences.  The menu was extensive, the portions generous, and the rolls I had were amazing.  

I realize the outflow of positive adjectives is reaching absurd levels here but this place is just great.  I've had sushi 4-5 places in Charlotte and this tops them all.  Go eat!

Review for AYCE lunch! 

You cannot use the yelp discount on the lunch promotion. This is totally fair, since it's so inexpensive, but I just wanted to put it out there.

If you want rolls and rolls of sushi, do the ACYE option! I do feel like the menu is quite limited - lots of "plain" rolls. You can upgrade to fancier rolls, but we didn't. When you go for all you can eat, I don't want to upgrade, I just want what they have to offer. 

Like I mentioned, the rolls are very plain. They're all in a standard California roll set up - just with different meat/fish/veg inside. No fish on top, not really too much sauce on top. But, if that's what you're looking for, then this is great! I do think the fish quality was very nice, especially for the price.

The other items on the ACYE menu were different types of noodles, fried rice, egg rolls, gyoza, etc. The standard Asian appetizers. 

I enjoyed the lunch, I think it's a freakin' steal for the amount of food you can order... but I do wish they would expand their AYCE menu into something with more pizazz. Some other appetizers, a fancier type of roll or two...
Best Lunch special around town!  Also the staff, especially CRYSTAL, are amazing.  Very attentive and know how to take care of their regular customers!
If you're going for some delicious sushi rolls and creative drinks, you can't go wrong here. Great environment and staff as well.

I've been here twice and received very different service both times. First time was great, our server was extremely attentive and made sure we always had food coming for the AYCE deal. Second time around our server was all over and seemed to always miss our table. I'm unsure which is the norm.

For a faster and more casual sit down sushi restaurant, the quality and quantity is great. AYCE is a good deal and it's available every day of the week. I think some of the more negative reviews about the quality are unfair and I believe they may be comparing at an unfair advantage/ level. 

Only negative comment that isn't really even that negative.. weird chopsticks. I like to have my own wooden chopsticks and this place has plastic reusable ones. I like to think I'm pretty good with chopsticks but these things make me feel like a noob! Ha! The waitress kindly brought me a to-go wooden pair.

My boyfriend and I tried out this place because I had heard good things from several people. We went on a Friday night around 7pm or so, and while there were plenty of people there it was by no means packed. Though the hostess did scare me for a second when she asked if we had reservations after I asked for a table for two. 

The main dining area is very modern and clean, you probably don't want to show up here in gym shorts and I even felt a little out of place wearing a pair of jeans. But we ended up being seated in the back room, which was very cool. Each table is tucked into it's own little compartment with a circle cut-out opening - a nice intimate setting for date night!

The wait staff was very friendly and attentive. We ended up getting "The Love Boat" - several different rolls and some nigiri. The nigiri was fantastic, the fish all tasted wonderful and fresh. The rolls for me weren't so great - two of the featured rolls are fried, the spicy tuna roll and the crispy California. I thought the spicy tuna had enough flavor to it that it actually tasted pretty nice fried. However, the crispy California was very bland and I think I would try to replace next time. 

Overall, I would definitely go back. Between the service, atmosphere, and food I had a great time.

It was my first visit, everything was fantastic! Our waitress Chelsea was amazing, she even told us about the discount we would get checking into yelp. We had edamame first, hard to mess up.  Then we shared tempura onion, sweet potato, broccoli and zucchini.  Amazing! I had sushi something called the "O", it was great.  My friend had garlic noodles and hibachi broccoli and zucchini, she was happy with it.  We would both go back.

My husband and I have eaten here a ton of times! Seems to get better every time we go! The calamari is delicious as well as everything else on their menu! Bryan has done such a great job with this place that he's expanded and opened another location up towards the Huntersville/Cornelius area. 

If you love sushi, great drinks, and a great staff, this place is for you!

This dude likes everything about Pisces. I mean, it's my sign for god sake. The people are sexy, the food is decent and the ambiance is live. The bartenders pour a good beer and on Fridays the dude, Bob (I think?) makes a plethora of amazing mixed concoctions. This Bob feller (I think?) is also the bartender at Soul on Saturdays. Ask for him Bob (I think?) and he'll whip you up something nice. 

With the expansion, the dinner area is separated very functionally from the lounge. Go in for Sushi and stop by in the adjacent room for a saki bomb.

Love this place. I usually go for the all you can eat but on the rare occasion I go for dinner I am always satisfied with the beautiful rolls you can choose from. I don't think I have ever been disappointed here. The drinks are really good too. I swear by the garlic noodles - get them when you can.

Are you looking for the best sushi in Charlotte with the best service, a fantastic drink list, extremely reasonable prices and also a fantastic ambiance?! Look no further than Pisces Sushi Bar and Lounge. This place is truly amazing after two delightful visits.

On our first visit, we had a reservation and were seating immediately near the sushi bar. Our server was prompt and could answer all of our questions. The appetizers were incredible. I highly recommend the crab dumplings, that are basically just crab rangoons, and the fried eggplant, which is soft, succulent and amazing. The sushi selection is great and VERY reasonably priced. They even have an amazing selection of veggie sushi for the less adventurous (me). The asparagus and avocado are particularly delish. The cocktails are also amazing. The Kiwi something-or-other was so good I had two (thank goodness for designated drivers)!

On our second visit, we took friends from out of town to show off how fancy Charlotte is. I hoped that our second visit would be as good as the first and boy oh boy! was it ever! When we arrived, without  a reservation (tsk tsk), a group of about 6 people were leaving because they were told the wait was an hour and a half. We didn't have a backup plan, so we decided to wait it out. After getting a drink and standing at the bar for about 25 minutes, we were seated! The hostesses kept us posted on what was going on all the while and were just delightful. We were seated along the wall VERY close to the tables next to us. This turned out to be fortuitous as they recommended a few things we loved and were fun and friendly! Again, the sushi was fresh and delicious and our server was wonderful and tolerated out excitement. 

While this is already a lengthy post, I would like to note my favorite thing about Pisces: the size of the sushi. One of the things that really puts me off about sushi is how gosh-darn big it is! I can hardly chew it all in one bite! Pisces sushi is of manageable size, but it seems like you get more pieces than you normally would to make up for the skinnier rolls. I guess some people might find this to be a flaw, but it's the reason I will keep going back.

Now, stop reading this incredibly lengthy review and get to chowing on some delicious sushi!

I've wanted to eat here for so long and finally made it. It was so disappointing! All of our sushi rolls were very mediocre and they weren't even pretty - very sloppy. Charlotte must have some very low sushi standards.

2.5 stars. Good service and is nice like looking, great for big parties. Decent gyoza. However they omit basic rolls like tuna roll California roll and YT scallion. Sometimes that is what you want not the fancy concoctions. The fish seemed good but the rolls were super bland tasting. Rice had no flavor, zero seasoning on anything. And the spicy mayo was just mayo. Will try again but may stick with non-Sushi items.

Just came in for lunch today when it was super busy there. Lunchtime all you can eat sushi, fresh food?excellent service ?very clean environment, and the last important thing is good price . Like this place!

Definitely a fan of this place and I am mad at myself for not trying it out sooner!  Met a friend for dinner here last night and I tried not to hype myself up too much about it, but I was pleasantly surprised at a nice sushi/bar place in Midtown.

I got there early so it wasn't too busy, grabbed a table and was super surprised at how comfortable the chairs were.  Usually at 'super modern' places the comfort of the furniture is compromised for clean lines, but here my behind was treated to a nice seat and it is catered to make you want to stay longer and order rolls and rolls of sushi ;).

I ordered the house sake which was surprisingly good, and the other sake options on the menu definitely were enticing.  Our server was super nice and we had mentioned that we were both new to Pisces.... he immediately rattled off some recommendations from the menu.  Even had an "off the menu" item (a roll they are thinking about adding to the menu in the near future) called a "Stop, Drop, and Roll"  My friend ended up ordering that and I had a piece, definitely a nice roll and would stand on it's own if added to the menu.

The Kissy Roll (crab, mango, cream cheese in soy paper wrap) was refreshing... I also ordered the Screaming "O" at the recommendation of our server and it did not disappoint (shrimp tempura, cucumbers, aioli sauce, and a nice slice of jalapeno on top of each roll piece).

Overall I had a great sushi impression of this place....  they had a nice sushi bar and regular bar as well with a couple of flat screens.  Good place to wind down after work or catch a game on the tv... while having great sushi.

Thanks to my fellow Yelpers for recommending this place.  I am still new to the world of sushi but the pictures from the website are what drew me here.

What made this a 4-star review was that my group's server, Lily, was willing to explain the menu options in detail to a newbie like myself.  She recommended the cucumber special which was absolutely amazing!   I also had the Spicy Tuna and Spicy Salmon hand rolls which were beautifully presented and also tasted wonderful.

The decor of the place is modern.  The tables are a little close together.    Prices are decent here except I thought the wine was a bit pricey.  And I was absolutely amazed by the jellyfish aquarium.  It was so relaxing to watch.  

Definitely a place I need to come back to and explore sushi.

A very cozy and warm atmosphere with private booths. I would give the food three stars but overall 4 stars considering the $11 AYCE lunch - which includes sushi rolls and a few appetizer to choose from. The speed at which the food came out compensates for its presentation.

Overpriced and bland.  I went here on my bday, asked for a booth.  The place was half empty the entire time we were there but they said they couldn't give us a booth because they were 'reserved', presumably for people who never showed up?  I'm even tried playing the birthday card, but no dice.  Cocktails were average.  Our waitress was as exciting as a lint roller.  Food came out quickly but it tasted like what you'd expect at the mall.  3 drinks, 3 rolls and an appetizer came to $120.  Woof! Won't go here again.

Again this is one of the places i have been to over 1,000 times now deciding to write a review on since going here yesterday to indulge in a drink until my friend arrived so we can go onto our next destination near. The drink the waitress highly recommended was ok, can't quite remember the name of it but i do remember it was some type of mango cocktail with Saki added. Past times coming here i had the hibachi shrimp and chicken which is good and the crunchy sushi rolls are to die for. My boyfriend and i  came here one night awhile ago and our bartender was bomb she made us some awesome drinks. Didn't get a chance to take pictures of the seating they have cool seating areas here that makes you feel like you are entering a space ship or something. The bar which i sat at the counter top is made of rocks which is cool! If you don't come here for anything else at least try their sushi!

The atmosphere at Pisces just can't be beat. My date and I walked in, expecting to sit at one if the tables easily viewed from the front door. Then the hostess takes us around the corner to the booths, each one behind a circular entrance. I love the design, giving the appearance of some privacy, making dinner feel a bit more intimate.

We shared fried calamari, two sushi rolls and some shrimp hibachi. I also had a cocktail, but I can't remember the name. All of the food and drink was delicious. I felt that the calamari appetizer could have been a bigger portion. My date ended up ordering another. It's possible we are spoiled by Rusan's mega portions. That did not change the fact that we enjoyed the food, and the environment. I'm looking forward to visiting Pisces again.
